He is a farmer and the father of six children, three of whom are studying while the rest are independent. Lorenzo learned his trade at a very young age by working with his parents and siblings. Part of the harvest was sold and the rest was used for family consumption. The main crops they grew were bell peppers and onions.

Lorenzo is currently planting beans and corn, most of which will be sold in Boaco. His wife works by selling “cosa de horno” (a bread made from sweet corn, cinnamon, and sugar). He is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, fertilizers, and pesticides to prevent the propagation of pests that could ruin his crops. One of his plans in the future is to buy land for planting vegetables. This will give him more production capacity and improve his earnings so that his family will have a better quality of life. His next goal going forward is to produce quality beans.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is 54 years old and married with three children.

Estrelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dry goods like bags, pants, blouses, etc. to sell.

Estrelita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell dry goods business for 11 years and earns additional income from her general store.

Estrelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods like bags, pants, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, Halima has operated a business making fruit juices from home for sale. She faces the challenge of seasonality in fruits. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers’ needs.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase fruit for making fruit juices for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for making fruit juices for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling garden eggs in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for eight years. Ekua is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of garden eggs, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase garden eggs

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Even though Efua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Efua is an entrepreneur. She sells maize and garden eggs in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 20 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their six children. 

Efua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more maize and garden eggs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and garden eggs to sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 36 years old. He is married to Pamela, who is a business lady and also supports the family financially. They have two children who are three years old and a 9-month-old baby.

Alexander has owned a retail shop since 1998. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings. He has applied for his first loan with KADET Ltd., which he will use to add more stock of sugar, cooking oil, milk, maize flour and any other shop items. He will use the anticipated profit to grow his business into a wholesale one. He has a dream of making his business become a wholesale so as to earn more income which will eventually help him support his family.

loans.use: to purchase more retail goods like sugar, salt and cooking oil for sale

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
Toufic is a 41-year-old married man and the father of three children.

He is a Palestinian refugee living in Lebanon and working as a blacksmith since 13 years ago. Toufic works hard to develop his business; that's why he is applying for his fourth loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a forklift truck that will make his work easier in moving iron pillars from one place to another.

Toufic has a good standing and repayment history. His previous loans helped him a lot in developing his business and improving his family's living conditions.

He hopes to expand his business and be capable of working outside the Palestinian camp he is living in.

loans.use: To buy a forklift truck necessary for his business.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Alegria está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza el cual les ayuda a medir el ingreso de cada una.
Alba es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se esfuerza por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de comidas de todo tipo, en lo que le va muy bien, pues tiene mucha clientela que compra de ella sus comidas. Cuenta que su sueño es poder tener un negocio amplio de comidas para tener un mejor ingreso y poder ayudar más a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  verduras, condimentos, carnes, pollo y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende y también poder aumentar sus ingresos y salir de la pobreza.
texts.en:
The group called “La Alegria” is in its first loan cycle with the women’s committee program, where all of them work together and help each other to get ahead. They are doing an elimination of poverty survey, which helps them measure the income of each member.

Alba is one of the members of the group. She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person who works hard to get ahead and help her family. She makes food of all kinds, and things are going very well for her. She has a lot of customers who buy her foods. She explains that her dream is to be able to have a large food business so she can have a better income and help her family more. 

She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, condiments, meats, chicken, and other ingredients so she can continue making the foods she sell and also be able to increase her income and get out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meats, chicken, and other ingredients

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with three children, two of them attending school. She has additional family members, her mother. She owns the house she stays in and has access to electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and feeding the family.

Margaret sells agriculture produce from her home on a daily basis and works seven days a week. She has run her business for 10 years. She has no other source of income. The main challenges for her business are transportation and seasonality.

Margaret has applied for a 400,000 Ugandan shilling loan to enable her to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes, cabbages, eggplants and bananas clusters. Her goals and aspirations include expanding her business into a bigger food stall and also to start growing some of the produce.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, eggplants, Irish potatoes and banana clusters.

loans.name: Vecinas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Vecinas Unidas está en su ciclo 8 del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza con lo cual pueden saber el nivel de ingreso de cada una, donde 3 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con un ingreso muy bajo.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Maria, quien es una excelente vendedora, tiene todo tipo de prendas, y de muy buena calidad. Es gracias a las ventas que hace y al gran esfuerzo del día a día que da a su familia lo que necesitan para mejorar sus vidas. Maria es un ejemplo de lucha y sacrificio desinteresado.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, como ser pantalones, buzos, remeras, polleas y demás tipo de prendas para poder seguir con sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. Ella quiere mejorar sus ingresos y así ir mejorando la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The “Vecinas Unidas” [Neighbors United] group is in its 8th loan cycle with the committee program, where they all work together. They are doing an elimination of poverty survey, which they can used to learn the level of income of each member. Three members are below the poverty line, which is to say they have a very low income.

One of them is Maria, who is an excellent sales person. She has all kinds of clothing of very good quality. It is thanks to the sales she makes and also her great efforts day to day that she is able to give to her family what they need to improve their lives. Maria is an example of selfless hard work and sacrifice.

She is requesting this loan to invest it in clothing items such as pants, sweatpants, t-shirts, skirts, and other types of clothing so she can continue with her sales and improve her income. She wants to improve her income so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pants, sweatpants, t-shirts, skirts, and other types of clothing

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooked rice in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Esi is married and has six children. Her husband works as a repairer. 

The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

Fe has been in this business for four years. Fe earns more income from hog raising.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to buy farmland in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maselina

texts.en:
Maselina is a 59-year-old widow from Eregi in the western part of Kenya. She has five children who are adults, and their ages are 36, 33, 29, 25 and 20 years old.

She has a retail shop. She has been in this business for the last 13 years and makes a monthly income of 5,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She has applied for her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase goods like sugar, cooking oil and milk for her shop to then sell to the community. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into her business to grow it.

She has hopes of running a successful business and supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk and cooking oil.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with two school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Janet dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat oil and sugar.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El comité “Santa Lucia” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, el cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica, donde se encuentran sin muchos medio de comunicación. Ellas también quieren trabajar juntas para poder ayudar a su ciudad y barrio.
La Sra. Rosana se dedica a la venta de menudencia sale en una moto carro a vender por la comunidad y de esa forma se gana la vida.  Ella está muy orgullosa con el trabajo que hace, ya que es digno y por sobre todo honesto. Rosana, cuenta que con su grupo también quieren ayudar a su comunidad a ir creciendo y mejorando.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de menudencias, lo que la ayudará a seguir con sus ventas y mejorando así la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The “Santa Lucia” communal bank was created when several neighbors from the city of Santaní formed a group. Santaní is a neighborhood located some distance from the center of town, an area without much communications infrastructure. The group members also want to work together to help their city and their neighborhood. 

Rosana sells pork organ meats. She goes out with a motorcycle cart to sell in the community and this is how she makes her living. She is very proud of the work she does because it is dignified, and above all, honest. Rosana explains that, along with her group, she wants to help her community and keep growing and improving.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy organ meats, which will help her to continue with and improve her sales, and thereby her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pork organ meats for resale.

loans.name: Bezhan

texts.en:
Bezhan is 49 years old. He lives in the village of Bredza, Kareli district, with his 43-year-old wife and three children. Bezhan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. Bezhan has a tractor. He is tilling the land himself and plants haricot and peppers. There are also apple and cherry threes grown on the land. Harvested products are sold locally at the markets, and the family gets a small monthly income that is not enough to feed a five-member family.
 
Bezhan requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Bezhan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Bezhan will purchase a milk cow. The family will milk the cow every day to make dairy products, which will be sold locally at the market and among the villagers. Bezhan plans to use part of the profit for cultivating more land. He will plant more fruits and vegetables in order to develop his agricultural business and increase the family income. With the increased income, the family will have the opportunity to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Even though Ekua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Ekua is an entrepreneur. 

She prepares and sells banku for a living (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She primarily sells her banku in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began six years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children. 

Ekua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her banku. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty banku. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty banku.

loans.name: Tariel

texts.en:
Tariel is 51 years old. He lives in a small village in Martvili District with his two children and two grandchildren. Tariel requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milking cows and a calf. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land with 100 nut trees. They sell the dairy products and harvested nuts at local markets. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tariel requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Tariel has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Tariel will rent an auto workshop and will work as an artisan to repair cars. He will purchase equipment and pay the rent. He will work hard to increase the monthly income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to rent an auto workshop and purchase equipment

loans.name: Poli Group

texts.en:
Poli is a 45-year-old responsible housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and his monthly income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. 
Poli wants to purchase a new rickshaw for one of her sons so that he can help his father. Her son is 23 years old and he would also complete his education along with driving rickshaw. They are facing a lot of financial problems in life and this loan could solve many of their problems. Poli is hopeful that the loan would be a productive one for her.

loans.use: To purchase new rickshaw

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi es casada y vive en alquiler en la zona de Challapampa de la ciudad de La Paz. Es profesora en dos colegios y actualmente su esposo se encuentra delicado de salud por lo cual ella es el único sostén de su familia.

Requiere el crédito para que su segunda  hija termine sus estudios de Ingeniería Agrónoma y la compra de equipo que necesita para  dichos estudios. Una vez que la hija termine sus estudios tiene trabajo en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, a donde viajará inmediatamente.

El sueño de Deysi es ver a sus dos hijos profesionales y que tengan una vida más cómoda que la que ella tuvo.
texts.en:
Deysi is married and lives in a rental situation in the neighborhood of Challapampa in the city of La Paz. She is a teacher in two high schools. Her husband is currently in a delicate state of health, which is why she is the only source of income for her family.

She needs the loan so her second daughter can finish her Agricultural Engineering studies, and also to buy equipment necessary for said studies. Once her daughter finishes her studies, she has work in the city of Santa Cruz, where she will travel immediately. 

Deysi’s dream is to see both of her children become professionals and have more comfortable lives than she did.

loans.use: to pay the university so that her second daughter can finish her Agriculture studies

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She has no additional family members. Ruth sells agriculture produce from her home on a daily basis and works seven days a week. She has run her business for seven years. Ruth has applied for 300,000/= to enable her to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, pineapples, cassava and green banana fingers. She has no other source of income. The main challenge for her business is seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations include expanding her business and building her own house. She rents the house she stays in and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more tomaotes, onions, pineapples, cassava and green banana fingers

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, a 59-year-old man from Eregi centre in the western part of Kenya, supports five of his grandsons; married to Leonida, a business lady, he has four grown children.

Comfortably earning a monthly income of KES. 5,000, Charles operates a timber yard, a business he has had for the last 11 years. He has requested his second loan from KADET LTD to purchase more timber for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to diversify into another business.

Charles has a dream of starting another business so as to better provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more timber for his yard.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a merchant and runs a sari-sari or variety store business. She is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol and has two children. Erlinda is also engaged in fish vending and food vending, selling home cooked snack foods to the people in her area.

Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy additional stock and fish to sell. With this, she will be able to sell more and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock and fish to sell

loans.name: Kulangwa Group

texts.en:
Said, who is in his early forties, is a married man with four children (with gender balance) who are in school. Since 1989, after he finished primary school, Said has been managing his life by running a food shop business. He works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be Said's seventh loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania . With the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, he increased the shop's inventory with new foods which he previous lacked in his shop. With the profit earned, he covered family expenses, school fees and the children's bus fare to school. Said will use this loan to increase his inventory with more sacks of rice, sugar and buckets of cooking oil. He dreams to one day be able to have his own business premises to avoid paying high rent. 

He will share this loan with his loan group Kulangwa, which has 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his inventory with more sacks of rice, sugar and buckets of cooking oil.

loans.name: Jacel

texts.en:
Jacel is a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is 24 years old and single. She lives with her parents and helps them in their everyday expenses.

Jacel owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, an egg, etc. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she will sell them per piece for a higher price for profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby, and the people in the community. She earns Php 300 a day.

In order to expand her inventory, she is requesting a Php 12,000.00 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Jacel desires that her business will continue to grow and she is hoping that her family will have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gerondio

texts.en:
Gerondio is a 60-year-old married man from Anda, Bohol. He has six children. The youngest child is 17, while the oldest is 35. 

Gerondio operates a motorcycle transport service in his community. He transports customers with a certain fee from one barrio to remote areas. Aside from operating the motorcycle transport service, he is also engaged in fishing. He sells fish, sea shells and crabs. 

Gerondio lacks materials to pursue fishing, so he requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fish net, floaters and nylon. 

In the future, Gerondio would like to invest in another business to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like  fish net, floaters and nylon.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais 4 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 
É comerciante, vende frangos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (pintos, ração, vitaminas, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja reabrir a sua mercearia e construir um talho, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir fundos para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Maria is married and the mother of 5 children, 4 of whom attend School. She lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a trader and sells chicken. With this loan she plans to buy products (chicks, ration, vitamins and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future she hopes to reopen her grocery store and build a butcher's shop. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to obtain the funds to make all her projects a reality.

loans.use: buy products (chicks, ration, vitamins and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Arleta

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 2 filhos, todos frequentam a escola, vivem na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operaria agricola.Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e reabrir o seu estabelecimento comercial para aumentar o seu rendimento, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Arleta is married and the mother of 2 children who both attend School. They live in a house they own and don't support anyone else.

She's a farmer for a big company. With this loan she plans to buy construction material (cement, stone, iron and others) to continue to build her house.

In future she hopes to finish her house and reopen her commercial establishment in order to increase her income. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, stone, iron and others) to continue to build her house.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
El Sr. Claudio está casado con la Sra. Cynthia hace varios años, tienen 3  hijos pequeños que están cursando la primaria, por quienes la pareja está trabajando y se esfuerza al máximo, ya que quiere que sus hijos el día de mañana sean personas de bien.
Claudio tiene un taller mecánico propio que ha montado con  mucho sacrificio y que está creciendo gracias a su gran esfuerzo. La Sra. Cynthia ayuda con los labores del hogar. Gracias al trabajo que están realizando educan a sus hijos, y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar.
El solicita de este crédito para la compra de repuestos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir haciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudio has been married to Cynthia for several years.  They have three young children in elementary school.  The couple works and makes the maximum effort for their children because they want them to be good people in the future.

Claudio has his own auto repair shop that he set up with a lot of sacrifice and that's growing because of his great effort.  Cynthia helps with the household labor.  Thanks to their work they educate their children and buy all the household necessities.

He's requesting this loan to buy spare parts so he can continue giving his customers good service.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
Ariel es estudiante de Ingeniería de Sistemas y además trabaja haciendo mantenimiento de computadoras para pagar sus estudios. Vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa San Antonio en la ciudad de La Paz. Al ser de familia humilde, para Ariel es indispensable trabajar por lo que solicita el crédito, para la compra de una computadora que le ayude a realizar su trabajo con mayor rapidez y mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Ariel es terminar sus estudios y poder ser un apoyo más grande en su casa.

Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo de IMPRO y de Kiva.
texts.en:
Ariel is a Systems Engineering student and he also works doing computer maintenance in order to pay for his studies. He lives in his parent’s house in the neighborhood of Villa San Antonio in the city of La Paz. Since he is from a low-income family, it is vital for Ariel to work, which why he is requesting the loan. He will buy a computer that will help him do his job more quickly so he can improve his income.

Ariel’s dream is to finish his studies and be of greater help in his household.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop that will help him with his computer maintenance job.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi sells maize and garden eggs in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about eight years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have 11 children. Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Esi will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize and garden eggs, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize and garden eggs

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 37-year-old married man and the father of four children.

He has been working in the construction business since 18 years ago. He specializes in painting houses. In 1998, he started working on his own and made his own clients’ capital. 

He is well known in his region through his good work and customers' recommendations. Samir had one problem he is willing to fix. He needs a car to use during his work for transporting his tools and requested machines, if available, from one project to another, instead of paying someone for transportation fees. 

That's why he is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. He will buy the car, which will make his business easier and more productive. He hopes that through this car, he will expand his working area.

loans.use: to buy a special car requested for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials (iron, sand, cement and others) to continue to build her house.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante, vende bebidas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (bebidas alcoólicas, e não alcoólicas, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio adquirindo um mini bus para transporte de passageiros, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos suficientes para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Isabel is single and the mother of 3 children who go to school, lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a trader and sells beverages. With this loan she plans to buy products (alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks as well as others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future Isabel hopes to grow her business by buying a minibus to transport passengers. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to make all her projects a reality.

loans.use: buy products (alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks as well as others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha na função pública. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, chapas, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a casa e mobilar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos disponíveis para realizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Helena is married and the mother of 3 children who go to school, lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She works as a civil servant. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, metal sheets and others) to continue to build her house.

In future Helena hopes to complete the building work and furnish her home. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to make all her projects a reality.

loans.use: buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, metal sheets and others) to continue to build her house.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es divorciado y vive con sus tíos en la zona de Santa Rosa de la ciudad de El Alto.
 Trabaja como taxista por más de 10 horas al día para poder mantener a sus hijos ya que su ex esposa se encuentra desempleada y no puede ayudar con los gastos.

Requiere el crédito para el mantenimiento anual de su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo.

El sueño de Edgar es dar una vida más cómoda a sus hijos para que puedan crecer sanos y posteriormente estudiar una carrera.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y de Kiva.
texts.en:
Edgar is divorced and lives with his aunt and uncle in the area of Santa Rosa in the city of El Alto. He has works as a taxi driver for more than 10 hours a day in order to support his children. His ex-wife is unemployed and she can't help with expenses. 
 
He needs the loan to do the annual maintenance on his car, which is his working equipment. Edgar's dream is to give his children a more comfortable life so that they can grow up healthy and later go to school to have a career. 

This is the first time that he has asked for a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the annual maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Rob

texts.en: This loan will help Rob to be able to offer insurance for his acupuncture services. As a young adult, Rob was diagnosed with psoriatic arthritis, an immune disorder. At the time of his diagnosis, drug options were very limited and he began looking for other medical alternatives. When he discovered acupuncture, Rob was enamored by the healing qualities of the treatment. But when his insurance coverage ran out and he could no longer receive treatment, he arrived at two conclusions: first, that he wanted to return to school to study acupuncture; and second, that he was going to develop a business model that would offer affordable acupuncture treatment to individuals who don’t have health insurance. In 2008, Rob began his own business, City Acupuncture. In addition to offering acupuncture treatments, his company also offers massages and sells herbal teas and remedies. Over the next five years, Rob’s business grew and he now employs eight staff and has since performed over 50,000 sessions. However, located in the Wall Street area of New York City, Rob’s business lost power when Hurricane Sandy hit in October 2012. Rob was forced to close his business until the electricity was restored and, even after reopening, many of Rob’s clients were unable to afford or attend their appointments during the aftermath of the storm. After Sandy, Rob realized the importance of offering acupuncture insurance to his clients. This loan will allow Rob to cover the capital costs of becoming an insurance-based business so that he can offer his services to more clients. For more information on Rob’s business, visit: http://www.cityacu.net/

loans.use: to become an insurance-based acupuncture service.

loans.name: Amber Group

texts.en:
Amber is a 32-year-old, hardworking and independent woman. She lives in the Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two daughters and a son. Her husband is a heart patient and stays at home as his health doesn't allow him to work. 

Since 2006, for her profession Amber has worked as an efficient and brilliant tailor. She and her daughters generate income by sewing clothes and they are very expert in their work. Amber, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a new tailoring machine for her daughter so that her daughter can help her by sewing clothes. 

With the profit, Amber is planning to purchase one more sewing machine and wants to extend her business, as her other daughter also wants to help her by sewing clothes. She hopes for a good future for her daughters and son, and prays for her husband's good health.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for stitching clothes

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of five young children from Talibon, Bohol. Madelyn has engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than three years now. This is the source of their income. 

Madelyn is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights. With these tools, they will be able to improve their fishing business and augment their earnings from it.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a divorced mother of one child who attends school. They live in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, Beatrice has operated a washing detergents selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. Her goal is to expand and supply her products to a large number of customers. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase detergents for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase detergents for resale.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, four of whom are attending school. She has no additional family members. 

Teopista sells old clothes from the market on a daily basis and works six days a week. She has run her business for six years. 

Teopista has applied for 300,000 UGX to enable her to buy more bales of used clothes. She has no other source of income. The main challenge for her business is seasonality and thieves. 

Her goals and aspirations include becoming a wholesaler and also to build on her plot. She rents the house she stays in, and the family has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en: Carolyn earns a living through her sari-sari (variety store) business selling various goods and items to the people in her locality. Carolyn is a married woman and lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. She is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell like rice, beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and chips. In the future, Carolyn dreams of expanding her business in order to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell like rice, beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and chips

loans.name: Guidione

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém alem dos seus filhos.
É docente e quadro do Ministério de Educação. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, chapas, pedra, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para transporte pessoal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o pagamento do empréstimo para poder adquirir outros.
texts.en:
Guidione is married and the father of 3 children who all go to school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone other than his children.

He's a teacher and a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials (iron, cement, metal sheets, stone and others) to continue to build his house.

In future, Guidione hopes to complete his house and buy a vehicle for personal transport. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is paying back this loan so that he can obtain others.

loans.use: buy construction materials (iron, cement, metal sheets, stone and others) to continue to build his house.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém alem dos seus filhos.
É fotógrafo. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar uma motorizada para auxiliar no transporte pessoal durante as horas de serviço. 
No futuro deseja melhorar as condições de habitação e oficializar a sua relação, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos de investimentos suficientes para realizar todos os seus projectos
texts.en:
Ernesto is married and the father of 3 children, 2 of whom go to school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else other than his children.

He's a photographer. With this loan he plans to buy a motorbike to help him get around whilst he's working.

In future he hopes to improve his living conditions and make his marriage official. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to carry out all his projects.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to help him get around whilst he's working

loans.name: Boavida

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos todos frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais 3 irmãos que vivem com ele.
É operário agrícola numa empresa de produção de bananas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, chapas, cimento, portas, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e construir dependências para aluguer, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos disponíveis para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
Boavida is married and the father of 2 children who go to school. He lives in a house he owns and supports 3 siblings who live with him.

He's a farmer for a company that produces bananas. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials (sand, metal sheets, cement, doors and others) to continue the building work on his home.

In future Boavida hopes to complete his house and build others to rent out. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to carry out all his projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (sand, metal sheets, cement, doors and others) to continue the building work on his home.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 5 filhos que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operária agrícola. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, chapas, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a casa e construir dependências para aluguer, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos disponíveis para realizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Ilda is single and the mother of 5 children who attend school, lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She works as a farmer for a large organisation. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, metal sheets and others) to continue the building work on her home.

In future Ilda hopes to complete her house and build others to rent out. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to make all her projects a reality.

loans.use: buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, metal sheets and others) to continue the building work on her home.

loans.name: Santos Medardo

texts.es:
Santos, posee una tienda que comercializa productos de primera necesidad. El tiene 45 años, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 13, 14 años y se encuentran estudiando. El negocio  comenzó con una pequeña venta de churros en la casa, luego al observar que la demanda aumentaba decidió invertir un poco de capital para hacer crecer la tienda.
El préstamo que requiere lo utilizara para comprar los productos que más se venden tales como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, huevos, lácteos, embutidos, entre otros. Este ayudara a aumentar el inventario, las ventas incrementaran porque habrán productos que el cliente solicite en el momento que lo necesite y permitirá que el grupo familiar tenga una mejor estabilidad de vida.
 Su objetivo es optimizar sus ventas y con ello obtener mayores ganancias, asimismo su sueño  es aperturar  un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Santos has a small store where he sells basic, daily-use products. He is 45 years old lives with his wife and their two children, who are 13 and 14 years old and are in school. He started the business as a small store selling chips from his house. Soon, when he saw that demand was growing, he decided to invest some capital to grow the store.

He will use the loan to buy the products that sell the best, such as: rice, sugar, beans, eggs, dairy products, lunch meats, and other items. This will help him increase his inventory. Sales will increase because the products that customers request will be there when they’re needed. This will allow his family to have more stability in life.

His goal is to optimize his sales and thereby have a better income. His dream is to open a new business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, eggs, dairy products, lunch meats, and other items.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 46 years old and married with four children.

Judith works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Judith has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, biscuits and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Judith has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and she also earns an additional income from hog raising.

Judith aspires to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, biscuits and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Inviolata

texts.en:
Inviolata is a 56-year-old widow from Eregi, located in the western part of Kenya. She supports seven people in her family and has seven children who are 33, 30, 25, 25 (twins), 20, 16 and 14 years old respectively.

Inviolata has been selling in a green grocery business for the last five years, and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. She has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase vegetables and fruits for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by increasing the stock of foodstuff.

She has a dream of educating her children and running a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Julinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Julinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hog raising. Julinda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more goods like coffee, sugar, laundry soap, canned goods and other items to sell in her general store.

Julinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods like coffee, sugar, laundry soap, canned goods, and other items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Being the head of the family and a mother of four, Marites needs to work hard in order to give the best way of living for her children. She has to wake up early in the morning, go to the market and buy meat to cook for the menu that she offers in their village. She is also cooking snack foods for additional income.

Marites wants to extend her business to increase her income. She needs to double her profit since her children are about to enter the college level of education. Marites is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy meat, vegetables and fruits to sell. Marites believe that through her loan she will earn higher income and be able to send her children to college soon.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Albertino

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais 2 sobrinhas que vivem com ela.
É militar. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, barrotes, cimento, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais angariar fundos para pagar devidamente o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Albertino is married and the father of 2 children who go to school. He lives in a house he owns and supports 2 nieces who live with him.

He's in the military. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials (sand, joists, cements, iron and others) to continue to build his house.

In future Albertino hopes to finish his house and improve his family's level of comfort. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to carry out all his projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (sand, joists, cements, iron and others) to continue to build his house

loans.name: Aurélio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais 3 frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ele.
Trabalha como canalizador. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar um congelador para a sua casa. 
No futuro deseja criar uma micro empresa de canalização, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e angariar fundos para pagar devidamente o empréstimo
texts.en:
Aurélio is married and the father of 4 children, 3 of whom go to school. He lives in a house he owns and supports his mother who lives with him.

He works as a plumber. With this loan he plans to buy a freezer for his house.

In future Aurélio hopes to create a plumbing micro-business. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to work more in order to pay off the loan.

loans.use: buy a freezer for his house

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer emprendedora que trabaja para la educación y la manutención de sus dos hijos, tiene una tienda donde elabora y comercializa polleras y centros para cholitas, actualmente trabaja con una maquina domestica donde consume mucha electricidad y es muy lenta. Vive en la ciudad de El Alto.

Con el crédito que solicita comprará tres máquinas cosedoras industriales rectas con lo que ahorrará energía eléctrica y podrá contribuir con el ahorro de energía eléctrica, también podrá mecanizar la producción de sus productos y generar mayores ingresos económicos para su familia.
 
El sueño de Ana, es de contar con una tienda más grande y contar con mas maquinas para poder satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que existe en su mercado.

Esta es la séptima vez que solicita un crédito de Impro y la tercera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Ana is an entrepreneurial woman who works to educate and support her children. She has a store where she makes and sells traditional skirts and petticoats for indigenous women. Currently she works with a domestic sewing machine, which consumes a lot of electricity and is very slow. She lives in the city of El Alto.

With the loan she is requesting, she will buy three industrial straight sewing machines with what she will save in electricity, and she will contribute to saving electricity.  She will also be able to mechanize the production of her products and to generate greater financial earnings for her family. 

Ana's dream is to have a bigger store and to have the machines to satisfy the amount of demand that exists in her market.

This is the seventh time she has asked for a loan from Impro and the third with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy three electronic sewing machines for her store, where she makes traditional skirts and petticoats for women

loans.name: Xiomara Yamileth

texts.es:
Xiomara, posee una tienda de bisutería. Ella está soltera, no tiene hijos y no recibe ayuda del extranjero. Xiomara, aprendió el negocio en un taller a raíz de obtener mayores ingresos y así llevar una mejor calidad de vida, este lo realiza todos los días de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar piedras, diamantes, nylon, entre otros productos relacionados a la actividad; esto le ayudara a incrementar el inventario, aumentar la clientela y poder darles un mejor servicio, asimismo optimizar las ventas.
Su sueño es mejorar las utilidades para tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Xiomara has a costume jewelry store. She is single, doesn’t have children, and doesn’t receive any help from relatives living overseas. Xiomara learned the business in a shop because she needed a greater income so she could have a better quality of life. She does this every day from 6:00am to 4:00pm.

The loan will allow her to buy stones, diamonds, nylon, and other products related to her business. This will allow her to increase her inventory, grow her clientele, and provide them with better service. She will also optimize her sales.

Her dream is to improve her earnings so she can have a better income.

loans.use: stones, diamonds, nylon, and other products

loans.name: Lotus Group

texts.en:
Yusuph, who is in his early 50s, is married with four children (gender balance) who are in school.  For a period of four years now, Yusuph has been running a clothes selling business (fabrics). He works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to earn a fair profit per month.

This will be his tenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, he managed to increase his business stocks to resell to more customers. With the profit earned, he finished building his house at the village and covered school fees. 

He will use this loan to increase his business stock and start selling charcoal. He dreams to expand wide his project.

Yusuph will share this loan with his loan group “Lotus”, which totals thirteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his business stock and start selling charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more inventory like snack foods, canned goods, cooking oil, bread, biscuits and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Maria Cristina has been in this business for two years. Maria Cristina earns additional income from food vending.

Maria Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory like snack foods, canned goods, cooking oil, bread, biscuits and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a wall around his mother's house, since due to her age she can't do it on her own.

loans.name: Izzat

texts.ru: Иззат жительница района Шахритус, расположенный на юго-западе страны. Ей 44 года. Она замужем и у нее есть сын и дочь. Иззат намерена заняться животноводством. Она хочет покупать, откармливать и перепродавать крупнорогатый скот. Для содержания скота у нее есть сарай и скотный рынок находится недалеко от их деревни. С этой целью Иззат обратилась за кредитом для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота. В будущем за счет прибыли Иззат планирует расширить свой новый бизнес и увеличить поголовье продаваемого скота.
texts.en: Izzat lives in the Shahrituz region located in the southwest of Tajikistan.  She is 44 years old, married and has a son and a daughter.  She intends on practicing animal husbandry.  She wants to buy, fatten and resell cattle.  She has barn to keep the animals and there's a livestock market not far from her village.  With this goal in mind, she is taking out a loan to buy and sell the cattle.  In the future, she plans to use her profits to expand her new business and increase the number of cattle she sells.

loans.use: To buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Living Stone

texts.en:
Living Stone is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who is currently in school. For the past three years, he has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells hardware. 

To help expand his business, he has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more iron sheets and cement to sell, and will help him generate greater profits and improve his family's stardand of living. Living Stone hopes that in the future he will be able to build rental houses. 

Living Stone is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more iron sheets and cement to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 43-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 12 years he has been selling clothes, and he also operates a retail shop to earn extra income. Like most businessmen, he is faced with the challenges of price fluctuation and inadequate capital. He wishes to educate his children up to the university level and own a modern boutique and a wholesale shop. Moses intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice mill business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries necessary to her rice mill business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for one year. Mary Ann earns additional income from electronic load retailing.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to pay for rice grains and the laborers' salaries at her rice mill

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.es:
Ana, le surge la idea de optar por un nuevo préstamo  porque necesita más capital de trabajo para invertir en su negocio de destazo, venta de carne de res y cerdo. Este le permitirá comprar cerdos para engordarlos y luego destazarlos para así llevar a cabo la venta a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le permitió mejorar la productividad, aumentar sus ventas y con ello obtuvo mayores ingresos, los cuales sirvieron para aportar a la familia y los gastos del hogar. Las circunstancias familiares y las condiciones económicas se mantienen.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting this loan in order to invest in her meat sales business. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase pigs which she will fatten up and eventually sell in her butcher shop to fulfill client orders.

Her previous loan allowed her to increase her productivity, sales and overall income. These improvements led to increased support for her family and an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for resale in her butcher shop.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 64 years old. He lives in Ambrolauri District with his wife. Avtandil has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business startup, but without any success. His loan requests have been rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family's only source of income is from their agricultural activities. They have a cow whose milk is used in cheese production and a vineyard with 300 samples of wine. They sell wine and cheese at local markets. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Avtandil has requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Avtandil has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program provides startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Avtandil will purchase a truck and use it for transportation. He will get orders to transport different kinds of goods, and this will increase the monthly income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a truck and use it for transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 25 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo de tres años de edad. Ella vende ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres durante toda la semana en  la ciudad y en las afuera; también vende artículos de belleza. La mercadería la compra en la capital del país y viaja dos veces a la semana, el recorrido es bastante largo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más ropa y artículos de belleza y ofrecer mayor variedad de estilos a su venta y también comprar una cocina pequeña. Con la inversión, espera abarcar a más clientes para que sus ingresos mejoren y pueda brindar a su familia mejores condiciones. Su deseo es instalar una sala de belleza.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 25, is in a relationship, and she has a three year old child.  She sells clothes for children, women, and men.  She sells all week in the city and the surrounding areas.  She also sells beauty items.  She buys the merchandise in the country’s capital, where she travels twice a week.  It is pretty long distance to travel.

The loan that she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy more clothes and beauty items.  It is to offer a greater variety of items for sale.  She will also buy a small stove.  

With the investment she hopes to get more customers in order to improve her income and be able to give her family better conditions.  Her wish is to set up a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and beauty products and to buy a small stove.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
This is Jonalyn, 33, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Delfin, a purchaser, and mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. They are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Jonalyn maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Jonalyn hopes to have more customers and dreams to have their own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque es un buen recurso económico para incrementar la producción de hortalizas y asímismo los ingresos. Este le permitirá pagar la mano de obra para preparar la tierra donde sembrara tomate, chile verde, ejotes y asimismo comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para realizar la siembra.
El crédito anterior le permitió obtener una excelente cosecha y libre de pagos para poder comercializarlos en el mercado. Las condiciones familiares han mejorado y las circunstancias económicas han incrementado.
texts.en:
Pilar is requesting this new loan in order to invest in his farming operation. He plans to use the support from this loan to pay additional workers to help him with planting season. Some of the crops Pilar cultivates include tomatoes, green chiles and corn. He also plans to buy agricultural input products for tending his crops.

Thanks in part to his previous loan, Pilar's harvest last year was very healthy and full. He also used the previous loan to help with costs associated with selling his produce in the markets. His family's financial situation has become increasingly stable, thanks to Pilar's hard work and dedication.

loans.use: to pay additional workers to help with planting his tomato, green chile and corn crops, as well as purchase agricultural input products for tending his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Connielyn

texts.en:
This is Connielyn. She is 33 and lives in GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Danilo and is a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Connielyn operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bedsheets, blankets, and other home trappings. She also provides clothing, like uniforms, when there is demand and does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000. She will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business.
 
Connielyn dreams that her tailoring business will grow and hopes to give a good future to her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 44-year-old married man, the father of three children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2007; his car is his only source of living. In Lebanon, taxi drivers suffer from a very bad financial situation, since fuel is very expensive and the government is not supporting them or setting special rules for exceeding the number of taxi drivers in the region, which results in low income work for them.

Ahmad is applying for his fifth loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. His previous loans were invested in doing necessary maintenance on his car and answering most of his family's needs. Today, unfortunately, his loan will be to pay for his wife's medication. He puts in so much effort to cover everything she might need.

Ahmad is so pleased that he found Al Majmoua to stand by his side and meet his needs, since no one lends to the working sector in Lebanon. He hopes to buy a new developed car in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medication

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has 11 children. The youngest child is 6 while the oldest is 26. She engages in farming. She has been growing rice for 20 years. Aside from farming, Loreta also has a food vending business. 

Loreta requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos to buy fertilizers, pesticides and more rice seedlings to improve the volume of her harvest. In the future, she would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and more rice  seedlings

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 9 filhos, 4 dos quais já maiores de idade e outros ainda a frequentar Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É segurança numa empresa e tem um negócio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, refrescos, farinha, amendoim, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja continuar a solicitar mais empréstimos para melhorar a vida sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é controlar a oscilação dos preços no mercado grossista.
texts.en:
Feliciano is married and the father of 9 children, 4 of whom are of age and the others still go to School. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a security guard for a company and also has a business selling various products. With this loan he plans to buy products (rice, beverages, flour, peanuts, oil and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

In future he hopes to continue to solicit more loans to improve his family's quality of life. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to try to control the oscillation in prices on the wholesale market.

loans.use: buy products (rice, beverages, flour, peanuts, oil and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

loans.name: Puis

texts.en:
Pius is a 50-year-old man from Eregi centre in Western Province, Kenya. He is married and is blessed with three children who are 20, 16, and 12 years old, respectively.

He has a food stall, which is his main business. He has been running this business for the last seven years and makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. He has applied for a second loan, which he will use to buy plastic seats and tables for his food stall. He will plow the anticipated profit back into the business.

He dreams of stabilizing his business into a large one to make more income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy plastic seats and a table for his food stall.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth, 51, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo and they have four children who work. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.  

Lilibeth operates a piggery. She earns a living by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market.  She also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1200 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lilibeth dreams of expanding her piggery and hopes that all her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for sacks of feed and additional hogs.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es:
El señor José Javier es originario de la ciudad de Coahuila y tiene ya más de 6 años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, esta casado con la señora Maria Gloria y tiene tres hijos que están estudiando la primaria. El señor José Javier trabaja para una compañía de velador y la señora Maria Gloria se dedica a la venta de tacos y jugos por la mañana en la escuela donde estudian sus pequeños hijos.
Están solicitando un crédito KIVA ya que a su vivienda le esta haciendo falta el cambio de la tubería de agua, porque le que tiene actual mente esta en malas condiciones y quiere provenir un accidente. 
Con el sueldo que recibe el señor José Javier es para pagar el crédito y que la señora Maria Gloria se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio.
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y que tengan un mejor lugar donde vivir.
texts.en:
José Javier was born in the city of Coahuila and has lived in the city of Nuevo Laredo for more than six years. He is married to Maria Gloria and has three children in elementary school. José Javier is a night watchmen, and Maria Gloria sells tacos and juice in the morning at the school her children attend.

They have applied for a Kiva loan because their house lacks water pipes and is in bad condition. They want to prevent an accident. José Javier will make the loan payments from his salary, and Maria Gloria will pay household and educational expenses from her business profits. They want a better life for their children and a better place to live.

loans.use: to install water pipes.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano, es habitante de la comarca Las Canoas en las afueras de Teustepe, casado, padre de 6 hijos de 13, 11 y dos años de edad, dos están estudiando la primaria, su hijo mayor le gusta cantar música cristiana. 	Él se dedica a vender CD y DVD de manera ambulante tiene más de 10 años de trabajar en el comercio, vendiendo CD de música y películas con esta actividad mantiene a su familia. El quiere ir agregando nuevos productos para vender en su negocio es por eso que requiere el crédito para comprar CD, DVD, y lentes de sol. 
Su mayor anhelo es poder darles una buena educación  a sus hijos. Por eso lucha cada por conseguir y buscar cómo vender productos nuevo para mejorar los ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
