texts.en: Ayub is a 55-year-old married man with three children between the ages of 21 and 32. He buys bananas from farmers for his supply and his customers are the local residents. Ayub has been in this business for 12 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He hopes to become a regional supplier of bananas and improve his livelihood. Ayub is a humble and patient man who sees himself having many plots of land in five years.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying more bananas for sale

loans.name: Hasiban

texts.en: Hasiban is 55 years old and lives in the Balirampur V.D.C, of Kalaiya (Bara district) in Nepal. She is married with three children and owns a tailoring business. She has a very good personal reputation within her community. Most of the women and girls come to her shop to have their clothes mended and repaired. She has requested a loan amount of 60000 NPR to buy additional sewing machines to sew shirts, pants, blouses and skirts to meet the increasing demand.  Her plan for the future is to expand her business so that she will be able to support the needs of her family and to send her children to good schools.

loans.use: to buy additional sewing machines to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 48 years old and lives in Margibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia, with her husband and children. Only five of her children are in school and live at home. Her children are between 18 and 28 years old. For ten years now, she has been involved with business in the market. She was taught how to sell by her mother, and she enjoys business because it makes people independent. It has been two years now since she stated selling used clothes. She makes more profit, and her business makes her popular. She is asking for a loan to buy more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 38 years old and from Alicia, Bohol. She is married with four children, ages 6-12. Anastacia has been engaged in farming rice and a sari-sari store (general store) business for 15 years now. In her store she sell detergent, sugar, shampoo in sachets, cooking oil, vinegar and soy sauce. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, canned goods, toiletries and seasonings. This will help improve her inventory and sustain her farming needs.

In the future,  she would like to expand her business by adding different merchandise that she can resell for a profit for her store to earn better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, canned goods, toiletries and seasonings.

loans.name: Miwononvi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIWONONVI est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Goussi Louise, est âgée 43 ans. Goussi Louise est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Goussi Louise ne vit plus avec son mari. Goussi Louise a un enfant, scolarisé et à sa charge. Goussi Louise vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule les différentes charges de la maison. Goussi Louise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Goussi Louise vend des produits de quincaillerie et exerce comme activité secondaire la coiffure à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ces clients, Goussi Louise désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Goussi Louise sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIWONONVI, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group MIWONONVI comprises three persons who live in the same district. The group's representative, Goussi Louise, is 43 years old. She is the one in the photo with her hand raised. Goussi Louise no longer lives with her husband. She has one child, in school and in her care. Goussi Louise lives alone with her child and ensures by herself that the different household expenses are covered.

Goussi Louise did not attend school. She sells hardware products and has a secondary business styling hair at her home. This enables her to respond to her needs and those of her child without much difficulty. 

Concerned about satisfying her customers, she would like to bolster her business. To do so, she is requesting, along with the other members of the group MIWONONVI, a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase hardware items to sell

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Primavera es un grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, están en el sexto ciclo, donde cada una de las integrantes está trabajando por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les permite conocer el ingreso de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Viviana, ella se dedica a la venta de joyas y ropas , el crédito lo utiliza para la compra de ropas y joyas al por mayor para poder ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientas , en su última encuesta se encontraba fuera de la línea de la pobreza con un buen ingreso, pero de igual manera sigue muy entusiasmada dando todo de si para poder seguir creciendo y el día de mañana poder tener un buen local donde ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes.
 También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder progresar continuamente.
texts.en:
“Primavera” (Spring) is the name of a group from the city of Encarnación. They are in their sixth loan cycle. All of the members are working to move forward and help their families. They are taking a poverty elimination survey so that they can individually become familiar with the income they are earning.

One of the members is Sra. Viviana, who sells jewelry and clothing. Her loan will be used to buy clothing and jewelry at wholesale so that she can offer better prices to her customers. The latest survey indicated that she has risen above the poverty line due to a good income. At the same time, she is very enthusiastic about giving everything she has to continue growing. Someday she hopes to have a good location where she can offer her products to her customers.

One other thing to note is the work of the counselors. Somehow they manage to monitor the training and verification process on an ongoing basis. At the same time, they motivate the women to strive toward making continuous progress.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sardadevi Dhanuk

texts.en: Shardadevi is a 30-year-old married women with two sons and two daughters. The family lives in a small village called Kattiparsa of Kalaiya Municipality of Bara district of Nepal. She has a small grocery shop in her own home where she sells different types of products like rice, pulse and sugar. She is successful in her entrepreneurial venture. As a result of the success of her business, she feels it is time to expand the shop and offer a wider range of products to the customer. She has recently taken out a loan 60,000.00 NPR to carry out this expansion. Being one of a few women in business in the locality has earned her respect in the community. She reaches out to fellow women for mentoring who are interested in starting a business. Her plan for the future is to excel in the business and to provide quality education to her children

loans.use: to pay to increase her stock of food like rice, pulse and sugar to meet increased customer demand.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Bien Unido, Bohol. Lilia has been engaged in the fishing business for more than 20 years together with her husband.

Lilia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat. With these items, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Lilia has hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda is a 44-year-old married woman with two children, 17 and 23. She operates a business of rental houses and she plans to use the loan for renovation purposes. The houses are located in a densely populated area and most of her tenants are local residents. Sauda is a patient and ambitious woman and hopes to offer her children quality education and to buy more plots. In five years, she sees herself owning more plots though she faces financial challenges.

loans.use: to renovate houses

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en: Celestine is a resident of Kilifi, Kenya. She is a single business lady who runs a mobile money transfer shop that has been in operation for five years. She was introduced to Milango by her friends, and is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy phone accessories, and increase the till money/float in the mobile money transfer business. She believes this will help her meet most of her needs.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories, and increase the till money/float.

loans.name: Bubare Tukore Hamwe Group

texts.en:
Bubaare Tukore Hamwe group is located on the outskirts of Ibanda Town. The group is composed mainly of women whose major activity is agriculture. They fall into different categories including divorcees, widows, single mothers and a few who are married.
Debrah is a widow with six children and is a member of Bubaare Tukore Hamwe. She specializes in growing food crops and raising goats and chickens. She also runs a side business of a small retail shop with capital of UGX 100,000. It’s through these activities that Debrah has been able to feed her children, provide for their basic needs and send them to good schools. 
She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 through the group to buy goats and to complete a shelter for the goats. Her main customers are neighbors and passersby. The main challenge she faces are thieves who steal her goats overnight since she has no adequate shelter to keep them at night. This affects her business and sometimes she and the children have to spend nights outside guarding the goats. At times they fall sick due to cold nights and are unable to work or go to school. Despite all the challenges, Debrah is still a determined woman looking forward to change her future and that of her children by giving them a good education.

loans.use: to buy goats and complete a shelter for the goats.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.en: Mauro is a 55-year-old married man from Anda, Bohol. He has eight children ages 5 to 21. His occupation is laborer. His wife takes care of their children. He earns 4,000 PHP a month from services he renders for a construction company. His income is not enough to sustain the family's daily needs so he requested a loan of, 8,000 PHP to buy pigs, feed and pig supplements to start up a business. Mauro hopes that his pig business will prosper and improve their livelihood status while at the same time sending his children to school.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed and pig supplements.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She runs a bookstore which has been in operation for two years. She is a single mother and has been in this business, supplying textbooks through the shop, for two years.
 
She joined Milango last year and is asking for a loan of 42,650 Kenya shillings to purchase text and exercise books, photocopy papers and other stationery supplies for sale.

She belives the business will meet the required repayments and her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy text and exercise books, photocopy papers and other stationery supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials so that she can expand her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es: Israel es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra los principales granos básicos como lo son, maíz y frijol. Israel desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y poder hacer una mejora a su tierra que muestra en la fotografia donde siembra sus semillas. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Israel is a gentleman who is responsible with his household obligations. He has always been known for providing the best for his children. Israel currently lives with his wife and their two children. He is a very hard worker who always goes about his business with cheerfulness and enthusiasm. The main crops he plants as a farmer are staples such as corn and beans.

Israel wants to increase his sales, so he is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies. This will enable him to improve the land on which he will plant seeds, as shown in the photograph. He would like to have the assistance he requested because he has no other financial resources. This will help him to provide for his daily household needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, pesticides, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Liver

texts.en: Liver is 26 years old and married with no children. She runs a small business selling a variety of snacks and soft drinks in her community and has been doing this for 6 years. Liver has requested a loan to buy soft drinks, pork buns, snacks, and ice cakes. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Liver will help with her family's financials.

loans.use: to buy pork buns, ice cakes, hot dogs, Coca Cola, Sprite and Bongo.

loans.name: Kula

texts.en: Kula is 26 years old and lives in Magibi county which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and her husband is not working now. They have twin children aged 3. Since 2010 she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She likes how people respond to her business, and mostly she enjoys the interaction of her customers. She spends eight hours with her business six days a week. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Ramonito

texts.en:
Ramonito is a 23-year-old married man from Bien Unido, Bohol and the father of a one-month-old daughter. He is engaged in a food vending business selling native snack foods called "puto" (steamed cakes). He also operates a motorcycle transport business.

Ramonito works hard to earn a living in order to support the needs of  his family. He is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, food wrappers and others. Ramonito believes that this loan could help him improve his earnings and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, food wrappers and others

loans.name: Souheila

texts.en:
Souheila is a 50-year-old married woman, mother of three children. She has been working at preparing and selling her special handmade accessories for four years. In 2010, she started working on her own, and today she has opened her own shop to increase her income and expand her sales. She has a special talent in her domain, well known in her region with her special creations and prices.

She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to  make a front glass display for her shop and to increase her inventory with special  creative products, that will help her in designing more accessories.

She hopes to expand her business more as well as her workshop, and increase her production to reply to different customer needs.

loans.use: To make a front display for her shop and increase her inventory with special  creative products

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Margibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. All their children are between 14 to 22 years old and are in school. For eight years now she has been selling drinks, beer, stout, and white spirit gin at her shop in her community. She started her business with money given to her by her boyfriend. She is making more profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, beer, stout and white spirit gin for her business. Her plan is to increase her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, beer, stout, and white spirit gin for her business.

loans.name: Ashraq

texts.en: Ashraq is a 30-year-old single woman who lives in poor conditions in Taiz, Yemen. She is an employer who intends to start up a small education institute. She said that her business will be offered to educate people who are young to develop their qualification. The intention behind this institute is not only to get money, but to help youth who like to learn develop their skills. She is the breadwinner for her family where she strives to provide household expenses. She intends to furnish her institute but unfortunately, the amount she saved is insufficient to buy what she needs. Therefore, she requested a youth loan of 170,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to help her cover the cost of purchasing new furniture. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing new furniture for her education business.

loans.name: Sibasakti Group

texts.en:
Sibashakt is a Joint Liability Group located in Duajhar village. Duajhar is a rural village in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. The group was formed in the year 2009 and consists of four women members who belong to the BPL (Below Poverty Line) category.  Dalimba, sitting second from left with her hand raised in the photograph, is one of the members. She is 32 years old and lives with her husband, one son of 13 years and one daughter of 9 years who are studying in standard 8th and 5th, respectively, in the school in her village.

Dalimba has been running a photography and video shooting center in a small rented cabin in her village for the last 11 years with the help of her husband. Apart from this business, her husband is also running a photocopy center in another location. Presently, Dalimba has a computer system, three small digital cameras and two normal video cameras for her business. In the absence of her husband, Dalimba also manages the photo studio. Apart from indoor service, her husband attends outside calls from various social festivals, government programmes and other functions for photography and video shooting. Dalimba earns 6,000 – 7,000 INR per month. This is the fourth loan for Dalimba from Mahashakti Foundation. With the previous three loans, she has added some new assets to help her business. Dalimba says with the first loan, she purchased a screen and a focus light and decorated her studio. With the second loan, she purchased a video camera and with the third loan, her husband purchased a bike to help him in his mobility for outdoor video shooting. This gradual development helped her to increase her income. Presently, Dalimba is earning a monthly income of 6,000 to 7000 INR per month. But this amount is also not sufficient to meet her expenses like house rent, the educational expenses of her children and payment of the workers. So she is planning to increase her income by adding some more assets to her business. With the present loan, Dalimba is planning to purchase another computer and a video camera for expansion of her business. Dalimba's location has a great potential for her business but, due to the shortage of space, she is not able to expand it the way she wants. Dalimba dreams of constructing a photo studio of her own in a central place and giving a better education to her children. 

The other three members of her group are Bhagya, Padmini and Sumati who are doing a fruits and daily need business, a puffed rice business and a general grocery shop with fruits shop and paddy business.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and a video camera

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Majd is a 32-year-old married man and has two children. He lives in Taiz,Yemen. 

He has a grocery store, where he sells various products. His objective is to improve his family’s standard of living, in order to offer them better alternatives for progress. 

He has spent five years working in business. He didn`t complete his studies, due to the bad situations he faced and nobody tried to help him to continue his studying. 

He started his business by buying a small plot of land to establish his own grocery store. Most recently, he describes his biggest business challenge as the delay of payment from his customers. So, he is asking for a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to buy more grocery products to offer more variety to his clients, in order to always cover the delay of payment from his customers and thereby generate more income for his family. 

He is hoping that he can provide his children with opportunities to study and he hopes to expand his business so that it can continue to grow even more.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to offer more variety to his clients

loans.name: Wafae

texts.en:
Wafae is a single, youth client from Iraq. She is 26 years old and lives with her family. Wafae assists her father in providing the family income. She is a tailor, and she works in her house. Ever since she was a child, Wafae has had a passion for tailoring and In 1999, she started to practice tailoring a source of living. Wafae has gained an excellent reputation, thanks to her delicate work and competitive prices.

Wafae is requesting a youth loan of $2,400. She will use it to buy two sewing machines, to increase her production. Wafae is aiming to grow and expand her business, so that she may provide herself and her family with a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid is a 23-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been selling sheep for many years. He works hard to grow his business to increase his profit. He faces problems with this seasonal business because that type of selling is attracted through ads only. 

He started his business with limited capital. He intends to expand his business but he doesn't have enough money. So he applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy livestock to use in his business. He hopes to expand his business more to be a big merchant in the market.

loans.use: to buy livestock to use for his business.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo 2º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están trabajando por salir adelante, crecer juntas y ayudar a sus familias. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual permite conocer el nivel de ingresos de cada una de las miembros.
Gladys es integrante de este grupo, ella se dedica a las ventas ya que tiene una pequeña despensa en su casa, con la cual surte a sus vecinos y personas de los barrios cercanos. Siempre trata de tener un negocio bien surtido para que sus clientes queden satisfechos con lo que ofrece. Su despensa es el sustento de su familia y con esto está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas, verduras, carnes, pollo, productos a granel y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas e invirtiendo en su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Entrepreneurial Women), and they are now in the 2nd cycle of the women's committee program. These ladies all work hard to succeed in life, to grow together and to help their families. They are currently carrying out a poverty elimination survey, which records the income level of each member. 

Gladys is a member of this group. She works in food sales and has a small pantry in her home, which is filled with neighbors and people from nearby areas. She always tries to maintain a well-stocked business so that her customers are satisfied. Gladys' pantry is the livelihood of her family and her business helps them to move forward in life.

Gladys has applied for this loan to purchase fruit, vegetables, meat, chicken, bulk materials and other supplies in order to continue with her sales and to invest in her business plan.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, vegetables, meat, chicken, bulk materials and other supplies

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 28-year-old from Gaza. He has owned a shop for selling homemade perfumes since 2000. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an air conditioner and install a display window for his perfume shop. He hopes that this loan will help him display more goods and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and a display vatrina for his perfume shop.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 28-year-old married man who lives in Hodeida, Yemen. 

He has a small grocery store that he opened to help with the household expenses. He has three children, and he strives to support them and give them a quality education. He lives in a rented house where he faces a difficult challenge to cover household expenses and pay for rent. His business is not running well due to the lack of money to stock his business. This is why he's requesting a youth loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to purchase grocery products for his business. He hopes he can improve his family's financial stability with this investment and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for his business.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is 37 years old and married with five children. She makes and sells elei lavalava  to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. 

Eseta has requested a loan to buy paint brushes, paint, fabric material, and a paint board. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paint brushes, paint, fabric material, and a paint board.

loans.name: Mas

texts.en:
Mas, 53, is a local villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province.  She has six children in total, one school aged child and five farmers.  She manages two hectares of farmland to grow rubber tree seedlings while her husband works for others for a fee for extra income. 

She has been engaged in the current business for three years.  This is not the first loan for Mas with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner).  She has utilized her past loan wisely to improve her standard of living.  Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to buy bowls to collect latex and potash.  She hopes to collect a high yield of latex and make a good income so that she can enlarge this business.

loans.use: To buy bowls to collect latex and potash

loans.name: Alena

texts.en:
Alena is a 50-year-old woman who is married with five children. She runs a sewing business in her community. She sells puletasi, skirts and kids clothes to her village.

Alena has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, needles, threads and materials needed for her business. 

She plans to use her profits to extend her shop, and to save for her needs. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, needles, thread, materials, etc.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en: Rael is a 23-year-old married woman who has two children aged one and ten years. She operates a retail shop where she sells foodstuffs like cooking oil, maize flour, bananas, pampers, etc. and she plans to use the loan to buy more stock to upgrade her business. The shop is located in a market area and her customers are the general public. She has been in this business for eight years and faces challenge of insufficient capital to run the business. Rael plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and expand her shop. In five years, she sees herself owning a supermarket. Rael is caring and independent and this is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, pampers, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock such as soap, cups and plates to sell.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josephat is a 62-year-old married man and has six children aged between 15 and 40 years old. He farms french beans and bananas and plans to use his loan to buy more seedlings and provide transport for his products. His customers are the general public and schools. Josephat lacks capital to transport his products to the market. He plans to use the anticipated profits to open a shop where he can be sell his products and sees himself as a wholesale supplier in five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more french bean and banana seedlings and pay for the transport of his harvests.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with three school going children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past twelve years, she has operated a food stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits in the future.
With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and sugar. 
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Sreang's Group

texts.en:
Sreang, 42, is a local farmer from Kampong Cham province. She has three children, two of whom are still in school. 

To tackle her family's daily food consumption and other necessary expenses, she does cassava farming on a three-hectares area as the primary source of income; she has been in this business for 23 years. To earn extra income, she and her husband also works at a construction site.  

Never been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) before, she and two of her joint members are first-time borrowers. The total amount the group is requesting is 2,700,000 KHR. Sreang will use her loan portion of  1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, and to pay for a weeding fee. 

She hopes that she can gain a high yield from her cassava and sell it when the price is high, so she can make additional income to build a new house for her kids.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for a weeding fee for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Khem's Group

texts.en:
Khem, age 41, is a local citizen from Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She is married and makes a living by rice farming on one hectare of farmland. 

The current business, in which she has been engaged for ages, has earned her about 14,400 Cambodia riels (KHR) per day. Her previous loan was the first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She has completely repaid back her past loan and sustains her living in good shape. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is seeking 800,000 KHR, and her co-borrower is seeking 400,000 KHR.

As the group leader, Khem will use her loan portion to buy a cow to support her farmland. She hopes this purchase will help her to reduce the plowing fees that she has previously paid.

loans.use: to buy a cow to support her farmland.

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en: A widow with one daughter who is in school, Rath makes a living selling fruit. The rest of her family resides in Battambang province’s Sangke district. Rath has been involved in selling fruit for 20 years. Rath is a new borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is now in a group of two members that are applying for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy more fruit to resell. She hopes to earn more income so that she can set aside some money to buy a decent motorbike to support her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Thak's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of Tbaung Khmum district, Thak is a 27-year-old mother of two children, both of whom are still in school. The main source of the family’s income is from cassava planting, which she has been in for six years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 19,000 per day for daily expenses. 

This is Thak’s group microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Thak has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she fully paid back the past loan. And now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to lease plots of farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To lease plots of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Tbaung Khmum district where farming is a common way to make a living, Chhim is a 56-year-old widowed mother of three children. Cassava-growing is the main source of family’s income and she has been doing it for twenty years. The current business earns her about US$ 11 per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the first microloan for Chhim with Kiva’s partner. Now she is applying for a loan with VisionFund to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her cassava production so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kon

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Tbaung Khmum district, Kon is 54 years old and married. She has seven children. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and cassava. Having been in this business for almost 34 years, she and her husband currently can earn about 30,000 KHR per day per day.
 
This is the fifth microloan for Kon with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for another loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She will also use a portion of it to buy buffalos to help her in the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Heat's Group

texts.en:
Heat, 58, is married and has six children residing in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Chnang province. 

To support the family, she and her husband have been growing cassava for 12 years. Together, they can earn about KHR 11,000 per day and can save about KHR 3,000 each day for future needs. 

This is Heat's first loan with VisionFund. Heat’s group consists of two members who are both women. As the leader, Heat will use her portion to pay for rental land. She hopes this loan will enable her to have land for growing cassava to earn more income.

loans.use: To pay for rental land to grow cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa, 45, lives in one of the remote areas of the Tabung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She has four children, some of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

To support this family, she and her husband have been growing rubber trees as their main source of income. She has been in this business for 45 years, and she is able to save KHR 22,000 per day.
 
This is the second loan for Channa’s group with VisionFund. She used her first loan successfully in improving her living conditions. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to lease more plots of farmland to grow rubber trees. She hopes this loan will enable her to plant rubber trees in a timely way so as to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To lease more plots of farmland to grow rubber.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Sarom is 33 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school. 

The main source of her family’s income is from working at the garment factory. She and has been in this business for seven years. With the current business, she can earn about US $8 per day. Her husband works as a paid worker to supplement the income. 

This is the fifth loan for Sarom with Kiva partner, VisionFund. She successfully used the past loans to improve her livelihood. Now she wants to use this loan to buy a motorbike for her family to use to reduce transportation fees.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family to use.

loans.name: Heat's Group

texts.en: Heat is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  She is a villager from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She grows rice, which she has been doing for 18 years. This is the third loan for Heat with VisionFund(Kiva's partner). She has repaid back her past loan complete and it has supported her business promptly. Now, she is requesting another loan from VisionFund and in group of three people as the leader. She and one of her co-borrower are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each while a remaining member is applying for 400,000 KHR. For Heat, she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income so she can set aside some saving for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Phearum

texts.en:
Originally from Banteay Meanchey province of Cambodia, Phearum is 24 years old and is living with her parents. She supports the family business, growing cassava. For extra profit, her family also provides a paid-plowing service in the local area. Phearum has five siblings, but her parents can afford to send only three children to school since their household income is limited. 

Phearum has never been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) before. She keens to pursue a four-year, bachelor degree program, majoring in Finance and Banking. Therefore, she has decided to take an education loan from VisionFund Cambodia, as a first time borrower. 

She hopes that this loan will provide sufficient capital to support her studying, so she can pay more attention to her study and obtain a good job after graduation, in order to relieve the family’s financial burden.

loans.use: to support her studying.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey province, Ma Lay district

loans.name: Pheary

texts.en: Pheary, 23, lives in Banteay Mean Chey province. Her family’s main source of income is from their cassava farm. Out of her six siblings, she is one of the three lucky ones who her parents can afford to keep in school until she graduates from high school. Pheary wants to continue her studies at the university in Siem Reap province and specialize in accounting. Her lack of financial support, however, challenges her ambition to do so. Therefore, she has decided to apply for an education loan from VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She will use it to pay for university fees and buy school materials. Pheary’s desire is to find a good job after graduation so she can help her family to better its living standards.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and buy school materials.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey province, Ma Lay district

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin, a vendor in the local market in Kandal province’s Kien Svay district, is 57 years old and blessed with seven children. Currently only two children are still dependent on her, as they are in school. To help Rin in generating more income, her husband is working at a construction site. Rin has been engaged in her current business for three years. This is not her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid back completely, has returned her a decent income to deal with daily cost of living and to keep her children in school. However, recently Rin has been faced with financial issues, as her son needs to pursue his study, (majoring in engineering), at the local university in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Hence, she is applying for a new loan to pay for her son's tuition fees. She hopes this loan will provide timely financial support for her son so she can pay more attention in making more income for her household.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin, a citizen from the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, is 50 years old and a married mother of four children. To provide for the family, she grows rice on a five-hectare area, and her husband catches fish to sell. She has been involved in her current business for 30 years, earning about 54,000 KHR per day. 

Including this cycle, she is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan, which has upgraded her lifestyle in good condition. Now, she is seeking a new loan to support her business. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to gain more yield from her crop and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a business man dealing in photography. The business has been in operation for two years and employs two other people. Alex also owns a barber shop. He was introduced to Milango by an employee and is asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy a photocopying machine.
He had previously faced the challenge of lack of capital but sees that this can be eliminated by this loan. He now looks forward to a great business season.

loans.use: to buy a photocopying machine.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is 55 years old, married with two children. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. Adil sells mixed products in the market. He started his business 20 years ago. His monthly profit is 150 AZN. He would like to earn more profits from his business.
He runs a small store selling grocery items to the people in his town. His customers are mostly his neighbors, who are looking for the affordable prices he offers.
Now he needs a 2000 AZN loan to buy shampoo, soap, powder, butter, tea, rice, and flour, etc. Adil wants to use the money from his new business to help his family and raise his children. In the future, he wants to have a big shop to sell food and detergent products. This will be more profitable for his business.
He hopes to improve his family's financial stability with this investment and enjoy a better quality of life. This is his second loan and he has a very positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy stock for his store.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Alberto es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es casado, vive con su esposa. Alberto tiene  37 años de edad, es comerciante. Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de embutidos de fabricación casera, los cuales tienen mucha aceptación en la zona por la calidad del producto, lleva varios años realizando dicha actividad. Aparte de esta actividad también  trabaja en una fábrica de embutidos en forma aparte.
Adicionalmente durante su tiempo libre se dedica a la jardinería realizando principalmente trabajos de limpieza de patios para lo que cuenta con una desmalezadota, la cual adquirió gracias a un préstamo anterior que le fue concedido por la fundación. Es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación logró construir su propia casa y equiparla adecuadamente.
El crédito solicitado es para compra de una máquina de moler más moderna y de mayor potencia para su fábrica de embutidos caseros.
texts.en:
Alberto is from the city of Carapeguá.  He is married and lives with his wife.  Alberto is 37 years old and is a businessman.  He makes a living producing and selling home-made sausages which, because of the quality of the product, are much liked in the area.  Alberto has been doing this work for some years but also works in a factory that produces sausages.

As well as his work, Alberto spends his free time doing gardening.  He mainly does work cleaning patios and so has a weeding machine, which he bought with the help of a previous loan from "Fundación Paraguaya".  Alberto is very self-sacrificing and hard working.  Thanks to his hard-work and dedication he managed to build and furnish his own home.

Alberto is applying for a loan to buy a more modern and powerful grinding machine to produce his home-made sausages.

loans.use: to buy a grinder to make sausages.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann. She previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to buy school supplies to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. As a single parent, she works hard to provide for her children.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy more stocks of school supplies. The more items displayed at the store the better and the more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Mary Ann hopes for a continuous success in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share life and business of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of office and school supplies.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
This is Evelina, 60, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Elpidio, a taxi driver, and is the mother of their six children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelina manages her side car transportation business. She has one unit of side car or bicycle cart that carries up to two passengers to their destination within the community. Her regular customers are workers and employees in the community. She also has a direct-selling business for additional income. Every day, she earns a minimum of PHP 300 (Philippine pesos) in sales.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of her side car. 

Evelina hopes to expand her business in the coming years and dreams to have their own house and lot. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her side car.

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Tajy Poty está en el ciclo número 11 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza el cual les ayuda a saber el ingreso que cada una tiene, donde ninguna de las integrantes  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero pese a ello se esfuerzan siempre por no bajar sus ingresos.
La Presidenta es la señora Juana;  ella en su última encuesta aunque haya arrojado un resultado muy bueno sigue trabajando incansablemente para día a día ir superando todo tipo de obstáculos que se le presentan, pues cabe mencionar que ella gracias a su esfuerzo ya  posee su propio negocio de venta frutas, anteriormente lo hacía en forma ambulante y hoy día ya tiene su pequeño local en su propia casa.  Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante.
Doña Juana solicita  este crédito para la compra de  más frutas de estación, debido a que tiene mucha demanda, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual contribuirá al aumento de sus ingresos y de esa manera mejorar la calidad de vida de los integrantes de su familia.
texts.en:
This is the "Tajy Poty" group and it is on its eleventh cycle in the women's committee programme.  Here all the members work and help each other to move forward.  The women are undergoing the poverty elimination survey, which helps to identify each entrepreneur's income.  In this group no member is living under the poverty line but still they must put in the effort so that their incomes do not fall.

The president of the group is Juana.  Juana's last survey produced a very good result and she is unstoppable in her work every day as she overcomes any obstacles that she faces.  It should also be mentioned that, thanks to her efforts, she now has her own fruit selling business.  Before she was a street vendor but Juana now sells out of her own home.  Juana is very hard-working and always puts in the effort to move forward in life. 

Juana is applying for this loan to buy more seasonal fruits as there is a lot of demand.  The loan will help Juana to put her business plan into action, which will help increase her income and so improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for his truck.

loans.name: Olympia's Group

texts.en:
Olympia is 60 years old and lives in Rizalina, Rizal Zamboanga Del Norte. She is married, with no children. 

Olympia is engaged in a buy-and-sell copra and charcoal business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase construction materials needed for house repair. 

Olympia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for almost seven years. In the future, Olympia hopes to expand her business.  

Olympia is the leader of a two-person group (Olympia's Group).  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials needed for house repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Josue David

texts.es: Don josue vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas en casa propia el tiene un molino en su lugar de residencia trabaja de lunes a domingo con las señoras que hacen tortillas pues ellas llegan a moler el maiz para hacerlas con las ganacias que obtiene logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, don Josue solicita un credito que le permita comparar herramientas como. discos, ejes y otras herramientas que son de mucha utilidad para tener en buen estado su molino, y asi poder seguirle dando a  su familia el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Don Josue lives in his own home with his wife and two daughters. He operates a grain mill at his house. Josue works Monday through Sunday. The women who make tortillas bring him corn to grind. With the profit he earns, he is able to cover the household expenses.

Don Josue is requesting a loan so that he can buy equipment such as disks, shafts, and other parts that will be very useful in keeping his grain mill in good condition. This will allow him to continue providing for his family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy disks, shafts, and other parts for his grain mill.

loans.name: Kertha Bakti Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh, head of the group, and all members of Kertha Bakti Group agreed to continue to have loans for businesses. They still need a loan to develop a business, raising pigs. They will stop borrowing until they have enough savings for their own capital.

With full support from her husband, who works as a farmer, Ni Luh will use the loan to buy two superior piglets for IDR 500,000 each. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy feed. 

By still keeping the pigs for fattening, Ni Luh hopes there will be an increase in profits. For everyday needs, aside from her husband's income,  Ni Luh gets income from her garden and her other business selling religious articles for Hindusm.

loans.use: to buy two superior piglets.

loans.name: Arantji

texts.en:
Arantji is a 46-year-old woman and married to Nimrod, 47 years old. She has 4 children; Imanuel, 18; and Indah, 16, are both in the Vocational High School; Renaldy, 13, is a junior high school student; and Brayen, 9, an elementary school student.

Arantji has two rented rooms. She has been running her business for a year. It costs IDR 2,000,000 per room per year. In order to earn more income Arantji has planned to initiate a kiosk business in front of her house. Due to lacking capital, she requested a loan amount of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM.

She plans to spend the loan on goods such as instant noodles, snacks, soap, detergent, etc. She is expecting that TLM will help her by providing a loan for her new business.

loans.use: to buy goods such as instant noodles, snacks, soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: Sherly, 35 years old, is married to a farmer. They have been blessed with two children. She has managed a corn farming business at the village of San Pablo for almost 13 years. Harvest season in their area is only twice a year. After the last harvest she has a net income of 40,000 PHP. She would like a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can be able to improve her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Hanilet

texts.en:
Hanilet is 35 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Hanilet runs a business selling pearls in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase different type of pearls to sell.

Hanilet has been in this business for six years.

In the future Hanilet would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase different types of pearls to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace has engaged herself in a hog fattening business. She is 49 years old and has been blessed with four children. With profits of her business, she sent her children to school. Within ten years of beginning to operate her business, she is earning an average amount of PHP 6,000 every selling time. Nonetheless, she earns not enough to provide for all their needs. Thus, Grace is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000, which she will use to buy two more hogs, feed and medicine. She hopes to earn higher-than-expected income, for the improvement of their living conditions, and to save for future uses, as well.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs, feed and medicine

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.en:
Porfiria is 64 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Porfiria works very hard to provide for them.
Porfiria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, bread, coffee, cooking oil, sugar, soft-drinks, etc. in her general store.
Porfiria has been in this business for 10 years.
In the future, Porfiria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, bread, coffee, cooking oil, sugar, soft-drinks, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jinky requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, wood etc for her business.

Jinky has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Jinky would like to save enough to provide security for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, bamboo, wood etc for her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is taking a loan of $1,000 from TRM(Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and has 4 children.She has a shop to generate income for her family and also has a coffee plantation. Virginia has been thinking of how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better after she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes, and second-hand bags. Virginia is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), who offer loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes, and second-hand bags

loans.name: Dao

texts.en:
Dao is 57 years old, and is married with three children. Her husband works for a motorbike parking service. She has been running a general store in front of her house for ten years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.
Dao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more food and many kinds of soft drinks to sell in her store.
She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy food and soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Minandjangodo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MINANDJANGODO est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe,  nommée Victoire est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Victoire âgée de 50 ans est  veuve. Victoire a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et tous à leur charge. Victoire n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a seize ans que Victoire exerce comme activité, la vente de bois de chauffage et de maïs à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Victoire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Victorine désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Victoire sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MINANDJANGODO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MINANDJANGODO Group is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Victoire, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

Victoire is 50 years old and a widow. She has four children that she has to support. Some of them go to school. Victoire herself never attended school. For sixteen years, she's been selling firewood and corn at her home, a business which enables her to provide for her family without much difficulty.

She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. Eager to better satisfy customers' needs, she wishes to bolster her business. In order to do so, Victoire and  the other members of MINANDJANGODO Group are seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The previous loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn

loans.name: Ahissou-Ve Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AHISSOU-VE est formé de six personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Agnès, est âgée de 57 ans. Agnès est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Agnès est une veuve. Agnès a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et un reste à sa charge. Agnès assure seule les différentes charges de la maison. Agnès n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Agnès vend de l'akassa (pâte faite à base de maïs)à son domicile et par la méthode de distribution depuis vingt-un an, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ses clients, Agnès désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Agnès sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AHISSOU-VE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
AHISSOU-VE Group is made up of six people who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Agnès, is 57 years old. She's the one raising her hand in the photograph.

Agnès is a widow. She has four children, and some of them go to school. One of them is still in her care. Agnès takes care of the various household expenses on her own.

She never attend school. For 21 years, she's been selling akassa (a corn-based paste) at her home and through the distribution system, a business that enables her to provide for her family without too much difficulty.

Eager to better satisfy her customers, she wants to bolster her business. In order to do so, Agnès and the other members of AHISSOU-VE Group are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish the construction of a room.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Doña Flor de 35 años de edad vive con sus 2 hijos en casa propia ella posee un negocio de venta de productos personales como ropa, perfumes, desodorantes, cosmeticos, etc tiene buena cleintela su negocio lo tiene en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años con las ventas que realiza tiene buenas ganancias y puede cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, Doña Flor solicta un credito que le permita poder mas mercaderia que le permita poder tener mejores ingresos y seguir dandole lo mejor a sus hijos
texts.en:
Doña Flor is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. She has a business of selling personal products such as clothing, perfumes, deodorants, cosmetics, and other items. Flor has a good clientele. Her business is located in her home and she has been making sales for several years. She generates good earnings and is able to cover all of her household expenses.

Doña Flor is requesting a loan so that she can buy more merchandise. This will enable her to generate more income so that she can provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, and other products.

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Vicente” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Cada una de ellas tiene sus actividades diferentes, ellas se encuentran en una zona bastante alejada de los medios de comunicación, todas trabajan por ayudar a su barrio y que por medio del esfuerzo de ellas y sus vecinos puedan levantar su vecindario.
La Sra. Nadia es miembro, tiene una confitería y prepara tortas decoradas y por pedidos  ya tiene una buena clientela ya que siempre hace muy ricas tortas, recibe muchos pedidos y le esta yendo muy bien. Ella comenta que su sueño es que su comunidad vaya creciendo, que tengan un mejor acceso a la comunicación, y que los hijos de todos puedan crecer y salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, levadura, huevos, dulces y demás para poder seguir haciendo las delicias que vende.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Vicente" was formed by several neighbors in the city of Santaní.  Each member has a different business activity and they live quite far from social media.  They all work together to help their neighborhood get ahead.

Nadia, one of the members, has a bakery and sells decorated cakes on an order basis.  She has many customers because of her delicious cakes, so she receives many orders and business is doing well.  She says her goal is for the community to continue growing so they can have access to the media so their children can grow and prosper.

She is requesting a loan to buy flour, yeast, eggs, sweets and other products to make the delicious products she sells.

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, eggs, sweets and other products.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La  Srta.  Liz tiene 23 años de edad, es  soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por su hijo, para poder darle todo lo que el necesita y que no pase por ninguna privación.
Esta señorita es hija de una conocida artesana de la zona, ella desde muy pequeña empezó a trabajar con su madre en el negocio y con la ayuda de ella logró montar su propio negocio que es la venta de sobrecamas y hamacas. Actualmente ya tiene clientela formada en la zona y así aumenta su pedido de productos, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ya pudo hacerse de varias comodidades.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilo, telas y otros que en esta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes, para poder seguir trabajando. Ella es una joven muy emprendedora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante.
texts.en:
Liz, 23, is single with one son and lives in the city of Carapeguá. She is a very hardworking and enterprising young lady who fights to give her son everything he needs and ensures that he is not struggling.

Liz is the daughter of an artisan who is well known in her area. From a very young age she began working with her ​​mother in the family business, and with her ​​help she managed to start her own business selling bedspreads and hammocks. Liz has already established a customer base in her neighborhood, and orders for her products are increasing. Thanks to her hard work and dedication she has able to produce a variety of items to order.

Liz is requesting this loan to invest in yarn, fabric and other materials this season to meet the demands of her customers, so that she can continue working. She is a young, enterprising fighter who wants to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase yarn, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora  está en su Sexto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que les permite conocer el nivel de ingresos de cada una, donde 3 de las 17 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con un ingreso muy bajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marite, quien se dedica a la venta de leche, cuenta ella que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día, para que su producto ya este en la mesa de sus clientes para el desayuno. Es una persona muy sacrificada y emprendedora que se esfuerza por salir adelante y quiere ayudar a su familia por medio de ese trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de leche, con lo cual seguirá con sus ventas e invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Maria Auxiliadora" is in its sixth loan cycle and all the members have committed to working hard and helping each other get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey which allows them to know each member's income level.  Three out of 17 women are below the poverty line and have a very low income.

One of the members, Marite, sells milk for a living and says she starts work every morning very early so her customers will have milk for breakfast.  She is very self-sacrificing and enterprising and works hard to get ahead.  She wants to help her family through her work.

She is requesting a loan to buy milk so she can continue with sales to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 6º , ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual es una forma de conocer como se encuentran ellas con sus ingresos, donde 3 de ellas se encuentran con un ingreso muy bajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudelina, quien en su última encuesta  se vio que tenía un ingreso muy por debajo de la línea de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la costura y comenta que tiene un buen negocio ya que le esta yendo muy bien. Tiene buena clientela que siempre le trae muchos pedidos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha por mejorar su vida y crecer.
Solicita de este crédito para poder telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás insumos para poder seguir con su taller de costura y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Guapa" is in its sixth loan cycle.  The members are taking the poverty elimination survey in order to know where they stand with their incomes.  Three of them are at a very low level.

One of the members is Claudelina, who registered an income well below the poverty line on the last survey.  She works as a seamstress and says business is now going very well.  She has a good clientele and always receives many orders.  She is a hard-working, enterprising person who works hard to improve her lifestyle and development.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and other supplies to continue with her sewing business and satisfy customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Primavera está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres,  son mujeres trabajadoras donde todas  se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde algunas señoras ya están por encima de la línea de pobreza y otras están por debajo de la línea.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eva, quien en su segunda  encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza con ingresos medios. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, ella es modista y cuenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y buen trabajo ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela. Su sueño es poder tener un gran taller con el que podrá también ayudar a otras personas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás con lo cual podrá seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y mejorando de esa forma en su plan de negocios.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Primavera" is in its first loan cycle.  The members are hard-working women who help each other to get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and some women are already above the poverty line.  But others are still below it.

One of the members is Eva, who showed a medium level income on the last survey.  Through her efforts and continued work, and by using the applications of vital behavior for a successful woman, she is improving her situation.  She is a seamstress and says that thanks to her efforts and hard work she has formed a good customer base.  Her goal is to have a large shop so she can also help other people.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies so she can continue investing in her busines and improve her business plan.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa, se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las miembros;  Actualmente se encuentran  en el 4to  ciclo, con trece integrantes, queda 21 km de Curuguaty, donde todas trabajaran y se ayudaran para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 cuatro  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Blanca, quien tiene una cantina con todo tipo de productos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y cuenta que le está yendo muy bien en su negocio ya que tiene muy buenas ventas. Blanca quiere seguir trabajando ya que de esa forma puede ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de golosinas, bebidas, jugos, comestibles y demás insumos para poder surtir su cantina y de esa forma seguir teniendo ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Guapa" got together at the initiative of one of its members.  The group, comprised of 13 members, is currently in its fourth loan cycle and is located 21 kms from Curugaty, where all the members work and help each other get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and four of the members are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Blanca who has a general store and sells all kinds of products.  She is a very hard-working, enterprising woman and says business is going very well because she has a high sales volume.  Blanca wants to continue working so she can help her family and give them all the things she never had.

She is requesting a loan to buy sweets, beverages, juices, food and other supplies to stock her store.  This is so she can continue earning an income to help her family.

loans.use: To buy sweets, beverages, juices, food and other supplies.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is a 50-year-old woman who relies on farming rice for an income. She also operates a sari-sari store business (variety store). She started her business 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and merchandise that she can resell in her store. She is hoping that she can continue her business and even improve it so she can have a good profit. 

In the future, Flaviana hopes to improve her inventory and introduce new merchandise for her customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and merchandise.

loans.name: Judite

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É técnica administrativa. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas, cimento, pedra, barrotes, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a casa e construir um estabelecimento comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos disponíveis para realizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Judite is single and the mother of 2 children who go to school. She lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She's an administrator. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, stone, joists and others) to continue the building work on her home.

In future Judite hopes to complete her house and build a commercial establishment. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to carry out all her projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, stone, joists and others) to continue the building work on her home.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is engaged in farming. She lives with her family in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She also engages in a fishing business. Marites is asking for a loan to pay the school fees of her children. She believes that this loan can help her to send her children to school for a better education. In the future, she hopes to experience the fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a married businessman living in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a father of two and runs an Epson printers' service center. The business has been in operation for nine months and employs two other people. He was introduced to Milango by his friend and is applying for a loan of KES 104,750 to purchase Epson ink and printing materials etc. for the business. The challenge he faces is the lack of skilled labor, since he has to train people before they can be absorbed/employed into his business. He looks forward to a great business season ahead.

loans.use: To purchase Epson ink, printing materials, etc. for the business.

loans.name: Iolanda

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 3 filhos que frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como activista. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas, cimento, pedra, barrotes, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a casa para melhor confortara sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é angariar fundos para realizar os seus projectos
texts.en:
Iolanda is a widow and the mother of 3 children who go to school. She lives in her own house and doesn't support anyone else.

She works as an activist. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, stone, joists and others) to continue to build her house.

In future Iolanda hopes to finish building her home and to improve her family's comfort levels. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to carry out all her projects.

loans.use: buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, stone, joists and others) to continue to build her house.

loans.name: Lúcia

texts.pt:
Casada e não tem filhos, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante, vende produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (carne, frangos, roupas usadas, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio para obter mais rendimento, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a trabalhar cada vez mais para obter fundos para poder realizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Lúcia is married and doesn't have any children, lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a merchant and sells various products. With this loan she plans to buy products (meat, chicken, second hand clothing and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future Lúcia hopes to grow her business in order to increase her income. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work harder every day to obtain sufficient funds to carry out all her projects.

loans.use: buy products (meat, chicken, second hand clothing and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: This marks Rose's sixth borrowing cycle from KADET; she plans to increase her charcoal stock this rainy season. She has paid her loan successfully, and given increasing demand of charcoal this season, she intends to stock more sacks of charcoal. She hopes to continue servicing her loan well just as she has done with previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Garmi

texts.en: Garmi is 32 years old and lives in Margibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She lives with her husband and children; all her children are in school and between the ages of nine and 13 years. For six years now, she has been selling palm oil in the market. Her aunt taught her how to make sales; her business makes more profit and it makes her popular. She asking for a loan to buy more palm oil for her business; she plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Hellen
