texts.en: Hellen is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children and runs a food cafe that has been in operation for ten years. Hellen was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy a refrigerator. This is due to the challenge of food expiration in her business given that she buys fresh foods. Despite the high level of bad debts, Hellen believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children, provide income to the other employees, and also use part of the money to purchase a parcel of land for future development.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Elias

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filho ainda menor de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É fotografo de profissão e possui um estaleiro de venda de material de construção. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio construindo um estabelecimento comercial e adquirir uma viatura para fins comerciais, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é progredir ainda mais no seu negocio de forma a conseguir atingir o seu objectivo
texts.en:
Elias is married and the father of 1 son who is still too young to go to school. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a photographer by profession and owns a store selling construction material. With this loan he plans to buy construction material (cement, sand and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

In future Elias hopes to grow his business by building another commercial establishment and purchasing a vehicle for commercial purposes. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to progress even further in his business so that he can reach his objectives.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, sand and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

loans.name: Aren

texts.en:
Aren is 27 years old and lives with his mother in Vanadzor city. He has dreamed of becoming an engineer and being a student of Yerevan State Engineering University. But he hasn't managed to achieve this dream. After he served in the army he started to work in order to sustain his family. In 2008-2009 he trained in Moscow and used to work there for a short time.
After his return to his motherland Aren started to work in one of Vanadzor’s businesses as an electrician. His uncle, who is also electrician, has helped him by giving him the necessary knowledge. Now Aren is a good specialist and able to repair any electrical equipment and electrical appliances. Aren has a good reputation as an electrical equipment repairing master and have a lot of work in Vanadzor.
Now Aren is a skilled electrician and has worked in some different businesses supporting them with his electrical knowledge and is able to support his family needs.
Now Aren is seeking a loan from Kiva to buy some tools and equipment needed for his work.

loans.use: to buy some tools and equipment needed to repair electrical items.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is a business lady living in Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of five children although only the last three attend school. She is a milk vendor, a business she has run for one year. Kadzo is applying for a loan of 15,900 KES to pay for her children's school fees. She looks forward to repay the loan from the proceeds of the milk sales.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Donna is a 39-year-old woman from Ubay, Bohol. She is married with one son, who is 14 years old. Donna relies on making brooms to support her family's needs. She started her business when her son was still a baby. She is asking for a loan to buy fibers, bamboo and paint for her brooms. Her income will be used for her family's food consumption and her son's school fees.
In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business with a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fibers, bamboo and paint needed to make brooms.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a trader living in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of two school going children and runs a retail shop which has been in operation for two years. Mercy is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy wheat/maize flour, rice, cereals, etc. to stock her store. She looks forward to growing the business and will save the extra income for future use.

loans.use: to buy wheat/maize flour, rice, cereals, etc. to stock her store.

loans.name: Mirshamil

texts.en:
Mirshamil is a 52-year-old with two children. It is already 24 years that he has been growing fruits and vegetables and selling them. His wife stays at home, but is usually helping him. His business is profitable, but he needs money to make improvements.

Mirshamil has worked in agriculture since he was young, and it is his only source of income. He grows potatoes, tomatoes, and fruits and works whenever necessary. He wants to use the loan to add more stock of green vegetables, fruits, and cereals. He hopes to expand his business and give his children a quality education. His monthly profit from this business is 143 AZN. Mirshamil needs a AZN 2,000 loan to expand his business. It is his second credit. He hopes the loan will help him expand his business.

loans.use: to expand his business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has one child. A business woman, she has run a salon and boutique in the Mombasa area of Kenya for five years. She employs two other people.

Lucy was introduced to Milango by an employee. She is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy new stock of clothes and cosmetics for ladies, kids and gents.

Despite the challenges of inflation, Lucy would like to grow her business and also own a beauty training school.

loans.use: To buy new stock of clothes and cosmetics for ladies, kids and gents.

loans.name: Qadiraga

texts.en:
Qadiraga, 52, has two sons and one daughter. With his son’s help, he sells food products at the bazaar from Sunday to Monday. This is the only source of income for his family. The monthly profit from this business is 180 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN). This profit is used for his family’s needs.

There is insufficient profit to reinvest in the business and cover customer demand. Qadiraga is suffering for this reason. He would like to invest additional capital in the business and increase his sales. 

For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN to purchase and diversify foodstuffs to sell at his store. This will be his fourth loan, and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase and diversify foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary's business is doing well and she is grateful for the first loan she received. She now looks forward to add the stock of items for sale in her business for increased income. She is therefore applying for a loan of 93,850 Kenyan shillings to buy additional stock of cosmetics, oils, shampoos, ladies' braids, etc. She believes the business will raise more income to assist her in completing the building of her house and also become a wholesaler in the near future.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of cosmetics, oils, shampoos, ladies' braids, etc.

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en:
Nigar is a 30-year-old single woman. She sells food products in the bazaar. She has been in this business for two years. She lives with her parents, who help her, because Nigar's work is the only income in the family. Her father also helps her in this business.

The food products that Nigar sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 180 AZN. She is a very successful entrepreneur because she is in a good location in the central bazaar of her home city.

Nigar is now requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 AZN to expand her business in the future. She has a good credit history, and this is her fifth loan.

loans.use: to expand her business in the future.

loans.name: Panambi Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Panambi está en su ciclo número TERCERO del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Beatriz, quien se dedica a la venta de tortas, ella es muy hábil en lo que hace y gracias a ello le va muy bien. Ella tiene muy buena clientela y se está esforzando por salir adelante, siempre ha luchado por su familia y quiere seguir haciéndolo. Su meta es poder tener una gran tienda donde vender sus tortas y por medio de esos ingresos ayudar a quienes la necesita.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de harinas, huevos, manteca, dulces y demás para poder seguir haciendo las ricas tortas que vende.
texts.en:
This group, "Panambi", is on its third loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme, where everybody works and helps each other to move forward.

One of the group's members is Beatriz, who makes a living selling cakes.  She is very skilled in her work and so it is going very well for her.  Beatriz has a good customer base and she is making an effort to move forward.  She has always fought for her family and she wants to continue with this.  Her goal is to be able to have a big shop to sell her cakes and, with the income generated, she would like to give help to those who need it.

Beatriz is applying for this loan to buy flour, eggs, butter, sweets and more in order to continue making her delicious cakes to sell.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, sweets and more.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old and lives in Margibi county, which is the largest rubber producer in Liberia, with her boyfriend and three children. Two of the children are in school and between two and 10 years old. For eight years now she has been selling rice by the cup, vita, pepper, etc., at her shop in the community. 

Mary started her business with money given to her by her boyfriend. She makes more profit and has more customers. Mary is requesting a loan to buy more rice, vita, & pepper for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more rice, vita, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 41 years old and lives with her husband and only daughter in Sevan city. Anahit is an accountant and has worked as a chief accountant at one of the organizations in Sevan city. Since 2008 she has also worked as a chief accountant at one of the sports schools of Sevan city. Her husband works in a flour mill plant as the head of production. 

Anahit’s daughter is a freshman at Yerevan State University in the faculty of romance and germanic philology. She is a promising student and already has good grades. She dreams of becoming a very good translator.

She and her husband work very hard in order to provide for their daughter's good future. Anahit now needs a loan from Kiva to pay her daughter's tuition fees for the semester.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees for the semester.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold, 52 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Since 2010, his wife has been working as a sentry at the land-office. His elder daughter studies in the cooking profession at college and his son studies at high school. Ganbold has been rendering welding services to local people and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this profession. 

Ganbold is requesting a loan of MNT 1,100,000 to purchase seeds to plant vegetables, such as potatoes, carrots, and beets, and to build a greenhouse on his ring of fenced land. As a result, the family will use their own vegetables as food and will save money. More importantly, building a greenhouse and growing vegetables will contribute to the efforts against air pollution by converting carbon dioxide into oxygen. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to grow vegetables and to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Amardelger

texts.en:
Mrs. Amardelger is a 39-year-old widow who lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son works as an interior decorator at a private business entity while her daughter studies at high school. She herself has been rendering taxi services to local people on contract with a taxi company. 

She has purchased land which is 300 kilometers away from the city center and now one-third of the payment is remaining. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to pay the outstanding amount on the land. As a result, she can own land where she can build her own house, grow vegetables or rent at a higher price. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is bearing the whole burden of her family's finances.

loans.use: to pay the outstanding amount on a block of land

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbaatar, 24 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land.

He and his wife graduated from their respective colleges in 2009. He immediately began working as a sentry until employed as a plumber at a thermal power station. Even though his wife specialized in construction decoration, she now works as an assistant chef at a restaurant.

The house they live in has not been completed fully. Exterior layering work remains and the house floor needs improvement, so he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cements and planks. Using these materials, he can puddle exterior walls with bricks and cements as well as make a wooden floor. As a result, heat loss through walls will decrease thus enabling the family to burn less coal and therefore emit less smoke and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as bricks, cements and planks

loans.name: Anzhelika

texts.ru: Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Анжелика приобрела и успешно реализовала партию обуви. В этот раз она просит  предоставить ей кредит на закупку детской обуви маленьких размеров. Анжелика целеустремленная и трудолюбивая. Большую часть прибыли она тратит на учебу дочери в институте в Киеве. Анжелика намерена развивать свой бизнес дальше, т.к. это единственный источник ее дохода.
texts.en: Thanks to a previous loan Angelica was able to purchase and resell a batch of shoes. This time she is requesting a loan to purchase children shoes in small sizes. Angelica is a goal oriented and hardworking woman. Most of her profits she spends on educating her daughter, who attends college in  the capital of Kiev. Angelica plans to further develop her business as this is her main source of income.

loans.use: to purchase children shoes for resale

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz is 47 years old, married, and has two children, a 15-year-old and a 20-year-old son. Eyvaz has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. He wants his his sons to go into business. His younger son goes to school and his elder son goes to college. 

This is Eyvaz's first loan from Kiva. He started his taxi-driving business six years ago. Now he needs an AZN 1,500 (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to repair his car because his car has broken down. He is thankful to Komak Credit Union and Kiva for supporting him. He wants to use the money from his business to help his family and to change his car. 

In the future, he wants to buy a new car because this car is old and uncomfortable for passengers. This will make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Gayratjon

texts.ru:
Гайратчон молодой,энергичный  парень в возрасте 26 лет.  Он пока еще не женат и живет со своими родителями.   Гайратчон живет по принципу, пока сам не накопит достаточную сумму денег для своей свадьбы, не женится.   Он очень трудолюбивый и хозяйственный человек.  
 Вот уже 9 лет как Гайратчон занимается купле- продажей орехов  со своей матерью. Этот бизнес у них является единственным доходом в семье.  Он  получает от этого бизнеса  хорошую прибыль.  Гайратчон приобретает орехи в другом городе и продает по дороже в своем селе.  
На данный момент Гайратчон хочет закупить орехов и с этой целью он обратился в Арванд за кредитом.  На полученный кредит он купит несколько мешков орехов и надеется на поддержку со стороны организации Арванд.
texts.en:
Gayratjon is a young, energetic guy, 26 years of age.  He's not yet married and lives with his parents.  Gayratjon lives by the principle of not marrying until he himself has not saved up enough money for his own wedding.  He's a very hardworking and hospitable person.  

For nine years he has bought and sold nuts with his mother.  This business is the sole source of income for the family and brings in a good profit.  Gayratjon buys nuts in another city and sells them at a higher price in his village.  At this time, he wants to buy more nuts, so he has turned to Arvand for a loan.  With this loan, he will buy a few bags of them.  He relies on the support of Arvand.

loans.use: to buy nuts

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She is a married mother of two and runs a food cafe, which has been in operation for two years. 

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 42,650 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals etc. Despite the challenge of seasonal changes, Naomi believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children, and also use part of the money to open a larger cafe.

loans.use: to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals etc.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.ru:
Сергей родился . в городе Капан и проживает в селе Сюник.
После школы Сергей поступил в Ереванский Зооветеринарный институт, по специальности ветеринар. Сергей работает завучем в Капанской школе и в то же время с 2005года в селе Сюник занимается сельским хозяйством,скотоводством ,пчеловодством и держит кур.  Сергей  имеет собственную землю в  Сюнике где выращивает овощи, которые реализует в Капане и сеет сену, которую продает фермерским предприятиям.  

Сергей долгие годы занимается также пчеловодством. Он имеет более 15 улей и от реализации меда в рынках получает приличный доход. как говорит Сергей ,чтобы от пчеловодство получать хороший мед надо во первых очень любить пчел, заботится о них с большим терпением.

Сергей женат и имеет двух дочерей. В пчеловодстве и по сельскому хозяйству ему очень помогает его жена. 
С помощью первого кредита от Кива Сергей купил корову и рамки для пчел.
Сергею нужен кредит на сумму 300,000 Армянских драм для покупки новых улей, рамок и спецодежды для пчеловодства.
texts.en:
Sergey was born in the city of Kapan and now lives in the village of Syunik.  After school, he studied at the zootechnical-veterinary institute of Yerevan, specializing in veterinary science.  He now works as a director of studies in a school located in Kapan.  At the same time he has been involved in agriculture, animal husbandry, beekeeping, and raising chickens in his village since 2005.  Sergey owns some land in Syunik and he grows vegetables which he sells locally.  He also grows hay which he sells to a farming business.

Sergey has been involved in beekeeping for many years.  He owns more than 15 beehives and makes a decent income from selling honey at the market.  According to Sergey, in order to make some good honey, you need to first and foremost love your bees and to take care of them with a lot of patience. 

Sergey is married and he has two daughters.  His wife greatly helps him to manage his farming and beekeeping businesses.

Sergey needs a loan of 300,000 Armenian dram to buy additional beehives, frames and protective clothing for beekeeping.

loans.use: to buy new hives, frames and protective clothing for beekeeping.

loans.name: Odhuu

texts.en: Odhuu is 27 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a house in Orhon province of Mongolia. Her husband Bazargur is 27 years old and works in a local company. Her children Enhtulga, age five, and Enhsuvd, age three, go to a local kindergarten. She has been running her organic dairy products sales business in a local market since 2012. She has built a closer relationship with her customers and suppliers over the period and now she is requesting 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products from herders to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, friendly and positive woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products from herders and sell to local customers

loans.name: Bashkim

texts.en:
Bashkim wants to thank all Kiva lenders for the previous loan, which helped him to improve his mobile business of selling hamburgers. With the previous loan he bought tables, chairs and an umbrella and was able to increase his business profit. He used these profits to help his family and managed to improve the condition of his family life. Bashkim is very satisfied with his business and is planning to continue in the future. 

Bashkim is now requesting a second loan for this business to buy a new big table and umbrella. This loan will allow him to have a working table and to transform his business from mobile to permanent. In the future he hopes to increase, expand, and generate income from his business even more, like owning a big fast food shop, and provide a secure life for his family. 

He would like to thank Kiva lenders again for their support the second time!

loans.use: to buy a table and an umbrella.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Мавчуда добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 сына. Мавчуда всегда старается найти новый источник дохода и улучшить условию проживания. Мавчуда с детства помогала родителям по скотоводству и поэтому имеет большого опыта по данному отраслью бизнеса. Она планирует организовать свой бизнес купле продажей скота. Ее сын обещал помогать ей введение бизнеса. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она получила много новой информации и благодарно за этот курс. 
Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavchuda is a thoughtful and determined woman. She is 45 years old, married, and and is raising one son. Mavchuda is always trying to find a new source of income and improve their standard of living. As a child she helped her parents raise livestock, which gave her an enormous amount of experience in this field of business. Now she is planning to start her own business selling livestock. Her son has promised to help her run the business. She took a course offered by the Businesswomen's Association called "Getting Ahead" and received a certificate. She learned much from this course. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to buy cattle to start her business. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy cattle for starting a new business

loans.name: Ayora

texts.ru: Айёра умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 24 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. После окончания средней школы она поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет. Окончив отлично университет по специальности программиста, она осталась работать в университете. Более 7 месяцев она работает программистом в Таджикском Государственном Университете. Она очень любит свою работу и много времени проводит на работе. Она последнее время не успевает по домашним делам, например для нее очень тяжело стирка одежд. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США для покупки стиральной машины. Этот займ поможет ей своевременно выполнять домашние дела и больше заняться с любимой работой. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ayora is an intelligent and hard-working woman. She is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents. After graduating from high school, Ayora entered the Tajik State University. Following graduation as a software programmer with excellent marks, she stayed at the university and has now worked there as a programmer for over 7 months. Ayora loves her work and spends a lot of time at her job. Lately, she's been falling behind with her household chores - for example, she finds it difficult to find enough time to wash her clothes. Ayora is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a washing machine, which will help her to take care of household tasks quickly and spend more time at her favourite job. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her household

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for ten years. In this business, he sells retail stock, e.g., rice, sugar, flour, and cooking oil. He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is lack of capital. 

Tonny is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy retail stock like sugar, flour etc.

loans.name: Alimamy

texts.en:
This is Alimamy, who is 26 years old.   He is single, and has no child.   He has one  dependent, a sales assistant. 

In 2005, Alimamy established his business of selling mobile-phone credit-card vouchers, charging phones, and selling drinks. He began his business because he had no financial support to continue his education. His business is located in City Center.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 300,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to buy more drinks.  He hopes that this loan will help support him.  In the future, Alimamy plans to further his education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials for making beds, doors, etc.

loans.name: Tawah

texts.en:
Tawah is 33 years old, married, and lives in Montserrado County, which is the number one commercial city in Liberia because it is the capital city of Liberia. She is a high school graduate.

For three years she has been involved in the sales of fashion dresses and fabric (traditional cloth). She has many customers because she sells quality products. She started this business with money from her grandmother and learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She spends eight hours, six days a week, on her business. One of the problems she faces is vehicle traffic, so sometimes she is late getting her shop open. 

Tawah is requesting a loan to buy more fashion dresses and fabric to increase her sales. She plans to establish another shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fashion dresses and fabric to increase her sales.

loans.name: Shermuhammad

texts.ru: Шермухаммад родился в районе Шахритуз на юго-западе Таджикистана. Ему 28 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Шермухаммад получил только среднее образование. Он на своем небольшом участке земли занимается земледелием.  Сейчас он решил попробовать себя в сфере животноводства. Шермухаммад построил коровник для содержания скота и обратился за кредитом, чтобы начать бизнес. Шермухаммаду в разведении скота будет помогать его семья. Он просит кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Shermuhammad was born in the Shahrituz region in the south-west of Tajikistan. He is 28 years old, married, and a father of three. He only received secondary education.

Shermuhammad has been engaged in farming on his small plot of land, and has now decided to test the waters of animal husbandry. He has built a cow shed for keeping cattle and applied for a loan to start his new business. Shermuhammad's family will help him tend the livestock. He is requesting this loan to purchase cattle for subsequent resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle for raising and subsequent resale

loans.name: Usmon

texts.ru: Усмону 26 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребёнка. Усмон вместе с семьей живет в районе Шахритуз в юго-западной части Таджикистана. Климат района подходит для ведения сельского хозяйства, поэтому многие жители района, в том числе и Усмон занимаются этим видом деятельности. Одновременно Усмон занимается ремонтом домов. Сейчас Усмон хочет начать бизнес в области животноводства, а именно заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Для этого у него есть сарай для содержания скота и машина для перевозки корма скота из базара в дом. Усмон берет кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Usmon is 26, married and has one child. He lives with his family in Shahrituz in southwestern Tajikistan. The climate is good for growing crops, and so many of the residents of the area, including Usmon, work in agriculture. Usmon also repairs houses. He wants to start his own business raising livestock, in particular, raising, fattening, and selling cattle. He has a shed for sheltering the cattle and a car for hauling animal feed from the market. Usmon is requesting a loan to buy, raise, and sell cattle.

loans.use: to buy and raise cattle

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is a 33-year-old lady from Migosi location in Kisumu, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She supports five people in her family. 

Caren is married to Solomon, who is a business man who provides little support to the family.  She has four children between the ages of one and eleven.

She has been selling second-hand clothes for the last three years, and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 40,000.  Caren is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes. She will use the anticipated profit to diversify in other businesses, such as selling shoes.

She has a dream of providing for her family needs by making the business more stable.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to sell.

loans.name: Sayram

texts.ru: Сайрам 50 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Детям 25, 22 и 18 лет. Ее муж пенсионер и получает маленькую пенсию. Сайрам работает в государственной организации по охране природы и экологии более 32 года. Сайрам очень любит свою работу. Так как она с детства любила такие предметы, как биология, экология и география. Сайраму очень интересно ее работа. Сайрам уже несколько лет хочет отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег, так как она тратит все свои деньги для покупки продуктов питания. Она должна отремонтировать все комнаты, так как все комнаты в плохом состоянии. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 900 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, краски, обои и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sayram is 50 years old. She is married and has 3 children who are 25, 22 and 18 years of age. Her husband is retired and receives a small pension. For over 32 years, Sayram has worked for the branch of the federal government dedicated to protecting the environment and ecology. She loves her work as she has been interested in biology, ecology and geography since childhood.

For several years, Sayram has wanted to repair her house. However, she lacks the means to do so as she spends all her money on food. She needs to repair every room in the house as they are all in poor condition. Sayram is requesting a loan of US$900 to purchase building materials such as cement, paint, wallpaper etc. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, paint and wallpaper for repairing her house

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married business man and runs a mobile money trasfer shop, which has been in operation for three years. He was introduced to Milango by his friends and is asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to increase the float for the till. 

Despite the challenge of delays in transmitting transactions, Joseph believes the business has great growth potential.

loans.use: to increase the float in the till.

loans.name: Dorotia

texts.en:
Dorotia lives in Malindi and is grateful for the previous loan she received through Milango. She would like to increase the stock of items in her salon in order to continue offering beauty services to her customers. She mainly supplies beauty products like creams and conditioners.

Dorotia is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to purchase salon products, such as cosmetics (creams and conditioners). Her aspiration is to open a larger salon despite the challenge of seasonal sales periods. 

She will use the extra income from this loan towards her child's education and to purchase a parcel of land.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics for her shop.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Samar is a 29-year-old married young woman; she is the mother to one son and one daughter.  Her husband is employed and gets a small salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Samar is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will allow Samar and her family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To purchase living room furniture.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is grateful for the previous loan she received through Milango. 

She is looking forward to improving the operations of her business by plowing a larger farm. She is applying for a loan of 17,210 Kenya shillings to buy seeds, fertilizer, and also looks forward to investing in bee keeping.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and pay for labor  for her farm.

loans.name: Fatmata's Group

texts.en:
Fatmata's Group consists of teachers based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) for 18,200,000 SLL for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they can meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can repay the loan. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Brima is the leader of these teachers. He is 57 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. He is a native of Masokeh village, in northern Sierra Leone. Brima has been a professional teacher for 36 years. He is requesting this loan, which he will use to buy house building materials, such as sand and cements, for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to purchase house building materials for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi appreciates the previous Kiva loan which helped her to boost her business. She is now asking for another loan of 40000 KES to supplement her business by buying more goats to sell. This will enable her support her children in the future. She thanks Kiva users for their support.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Ta Marr Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Ta Marr” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, increasing sales and consequently improving their living conditions.
 
Kumba is the featured leader of this group. The 47 year old is married to a court clerk; they have three children who are attending secondary school. 

Kumba has been a businesswoman for 14 years; she sells ready-to-wear clothing. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббату 35 лет. Она имеет очень тяжелую судьбу, так как ее любимый муж умер, и она осталась вдовой с 4 детьми. Мухаббат более 10 лет работает кассиром в авиа кассе. Она имеет большой стаж и хорошо знает все тонкости своей работы. Она упорно работает для того, чтобы обеспечить своих детей хорошим условием проживания. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом очень старый и имеет плохое состояние. Ее дети очень обрадовались, когда узнали об ее плане. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, песок, краски и.т. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhabbat is 35 years old. She has suffered a difficult fate: her loving husband has passed away, leaving her with four children. Muhabbat has been working as a cashier at an airline counter for more than ten years. She has a lot of experience and knows all of the ins and outs of her job. She is working hard to provide a good standard of living for her children. She is now planning to repair her house, for it is very old and is in poor condition. Her children were overjoyed when they learned about her plan. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7500 somoni to buy building materials, such as cement, sand, paint, etc. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as cement, sand, paint, etc. for repairing her old house

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with five children who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a dressmaking business, selling at the market, mostly to women. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing threads and needles for her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing threads and needles for her business.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a married man and has one child. He operates a farming business and he plans to use this loan to expand it further. Dominic has been in this business for three years and faces the challenge of insufficient capital. He is courageous and this is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to expand his farming business.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad retirada y un poco alejada de la zona céntrica, se han unido 13 mujeres, para poder trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Están en su cuarto ciclo y están saliendo adelante, también ayudan a su comunidad y su barrio para poder crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Guillermina quien cuenta que su sueño es trabajar, dar el ejemplo a sus vecinos del barrio y que así puedan tener un mejor acceso a los medios de comunicación, y seguridad, se ayudan todos para mejorar sus vidas. Ella por su parte se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una pequeña despensa, trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas y se esfuerza siempre al máximo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, bebidas, productos a granel, fideos y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir surtiendo su negocio y dar a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Thirteen women have built a group in Curuguaty, a remote city located far from the center of the country, with the intention to work together and help each other. They are in their fourth cycle and are getting ahead. They also help their community and neighborhood to grow.

One of the members is Mrs. Guillermina. She says that her dream is to continue working and to be a role model for her neighbors, so that they can have more access to information and feel safer, improving their quality of life. Guillermina is a saleswoman; she has a small grocery store where she works every day, starting early in the morning and working as hard as she can.

Guillermina is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, beverages, noodles and other supplies in bulk. She will be able to stock her business up and offer customers what they need.

loans.use: tob uy vegetables, beverages, noodles and other supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a hardworking mother. She appreciates the last Kiva loan, which helped her to prosper in her work.

She again comes for another loan and she intends to use it to buy more sewing threads, materials, buttons and needles to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sewing threads, materials, buttons and needles to expand her business.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 43 years old. He lives in the Rustavi District with his wife, daughter and mother. 

Gocha requested loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is small monthly salary earned by Gocha, working as a distributor at a private company locally. It is hardly enough to pay for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Gocha requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Gocha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Gocha will purchase a minibus and will work on the line to transport people and generate income. He hopes that the business will be profitable and he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a minibus.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman, age 44, and she has three children between 17 and 26 years. 

She has operated a cereals shop for seven years. The shop is located in a busy area and her customers are the local residents. 

Lucy plans to use the loan to buy more maize, beans, etc., for sale. Lucy plans to use the anticipated profits to expand the shop and also pay the loan. She is determined and sees herself more independent in five years time. This is her forth loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loans have been repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more cereals such as maize, beans, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 31 years old. She lives in the Khashuri District with her husband, three children and her parents-in-law. Her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Natia has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is a small monthly salary earned by Natia’s husband, working as a driver at a private company. It is hardly enough to pay for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Natia requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With this loan Natia will begin a trade selling used clothing. She plans to purchase used clothing from the wholesalers and then resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin selling used clothing.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on both a wholesale and a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 2,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. 

Her major business challenge is transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a van for transporting charcoal from the village to the market, and also to build rental rooms. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and power charges.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members (old parents). She sells charcoal, green bananas and sweet potatoes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 2 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 1,600,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more charcoal, bunches of green bananas and sweet potatoes.  Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family 

Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and also to buy a van for ease in transportation. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, green bananas and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is 35 years old.  She is married and has one child, age 7.  In 2008, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Sumitra plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

---
In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and two of her children go to school. She has one additional family member (nephew). She operates a studio at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 13 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 1,500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy camera cells (lithium batteries), film and envelopes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a better digital camera and video coverage machines. 

She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more camera cells (lithium batteries), film and envelopes for photographs.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (brother and sister). She operates a bar shop that she rents at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 2,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy jerrycans of local gin. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a delivery van to ease transportation and to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Sina is 50 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Sangke district of Battambang province. She earns a living through farming rice, which she had been doing for 24 years. Her husband is a construction worker.
 
Sina is the leader of a group of four women.  She is requesting her fifth loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and to buy gasoline. She has used the past loan to improve her family’s livelihood. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Mom is aged 32 years and married with two children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. For the last 10 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava as primary sources of the family’s income to make a living. They can earn about 27,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and manage to save about 14,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Mom has been a member of VisionFund for five loan cycles already, and she wisely and successfully used the past loans to make her living conditions better. Now she is applying for another loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She will also use a portion of it to spend on labor costs for plowing the cassava and rice field. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her rice as well as cassava production, so as to sell it for a good price to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Masiku

texts.en:
Masiku is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop selling cereals and household consumables like rice, beans, wheat flour, and maize flour. She also sells charcoal as her other source of income. She mentioned high inflation as her major challenge in the business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of sugar, a bag of beans, rice and 10 sacks of charcoal. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar, a bag of beans, rice and 10 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a green grocery business for the past six years, selling to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a restaurant business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase potatoes, vegetables, oranges and bananas for her grocery business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, vegetables, oranges and bananas for her grocery business.

loans.name: Sophay's Group

texts.en:
Sophay, 38, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district in Cambodia. He is married and has six children, three of whom are still attending school. For the last ten years, Sophay has been farming rice on three-hectares of farmland. The current business earns him about 53,000 KHR per day and he manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
Sophy has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles already and he completely repaid the loans. He has used the past loan wisely and successfully to improve his family’s livelihood. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on gasoline for water pumping. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his crop yield so as to make a better living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland and gasoline for water pumping.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother of three children, and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 8 years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenge is transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with three children between the ages of two and seven. She operates a shoe shop in a busy area, and her customers are mostly travelers. She has been in this business for two years now and sees herself as an importer of shoes in five years' time.

She plans to use the loan to buy more shoes to sell and to use the anticipated profits to open another shop. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM and she hopes to be very stable and a big supplier in the future. She is a determined and aggressive woman.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa is a 43-year-old mother of six children and earns a living through farming rice and cassava in the local area. She has been in this business for 20 years, and the current business earns her about 20,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to feed the family. Out of her six children, she still has three to take care of, and they are in school.

Channa is a fourth loan-cycle client with VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used her past loans from VisionFund to better support her family’s living and business. Now applying for another loan, Channa, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and will use a portion for plowing the field. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man, age 30 years, and he has one child, age five years. 

He operates an MPESA shop (a mobile phone-based money transfer service). He also runs a hotel where he earns an extra income. His customers are the general public. He operates in a busy area and faces the challenge of lack of sufficient funds. He plans to buy phones and accessories with the loan.

Simon plans to use the anticipated profits to support his family and sees himself owning a repair shop in five years time. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He is a determined person.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with three children and two of them go to school. She has no additional family members.  She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food. 

She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 1,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to operate on a wholesale basis and also to acquire her own shop.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 36, is married and has four children. He is an agriculturalist but also deals in coffee trading.  

He acquired a loan amount of UGX 3,000,000 for buying coffee to sell. John buys coffee from fellow village mates in its raw form and takes it to the processing machine, a business he started in 2005 after failing to get school fees. From this background he believes in working hard so that his children can get fully educated and meet their basic needs. 

He hopes to expand his business in order to overcome the challenges of inadequacy in the family. He hopes to build a permanent house after this loan so as to appear decent and forget about the current challenges.

loans.use: To buy coffee to resell.

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila is 49 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 20 and 15. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Lila plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

More than 70 pecent of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Teang's Group

texts.en:
Teang lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 26 years old and married with three children, all of whom are still in school in the local area. To support her family, Teang has been working as a farmer who grows rice and cassava. The current business earns her about 19,000 KHR per day to make a living and afford to save 11,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

This is Teang’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Teang has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Teang, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs in plowing the field. With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice and cassava to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Prey's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Prey is 28 years old and married. She has six children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. The primary sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and cassava planting. Having been in this business for several years, Prey can earn about 24,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 12,000 KHR each day after the expenses. 

Prey has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve financial burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Prey will use her portion to spend on plowing the field and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more healthy rice and cassava so as to increase her family’s income to improve her living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To spend on plowing the field

loans.name: Se-Bo-Gnan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SE-BO-GNAN est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Adèle, est âgée 33 ans. Adèle est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Adèle est mariée à un certain Antoine. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Adèle et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Adèle n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Adèle vend des bijoux par la méthode de distribution depuis douze ans ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ses clients, Adèle désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Adèle sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SE-BO-GNAN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group SE-BO-GNAN comprises four persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Adèle, is 33 years old. She is the one in the photo with her hand raised. Adèle is married to a man named Antoine. The couple have two children, of whom one is in school, and both are in their care. Adèle and her husband live together with their children and jointly ensure that the different household expenses.

Adèle did not attend school. She has been selling jewelry via the distribution system for a dozen years. This enables her to respond to the needs of her family without much difficulty. 

Concerned about further satisfying her customers, she would like to bolster her business. To do so, she is requesting, along with the other members of the group SE-BO-GNAN, an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry to sell

loans.name: Boern's Group

texts.en:
Boern, 36, lives with his wife and seven children in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He and his wife have struggled to feed and care for their children by farming rice and growing cassava which he and his wife have been doing for 15 years. Together, they can earn about 29,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future. 

Boern’s group of two have been members and he has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped him to relieve his family’s financial burden. As the leader, Boern is leading his group to apply for another loan. He wants to use his portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. He hopes to grow his rice and cassava healthily and earn more healthy crops to make a better living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Chean's Group

texts.en:
Chean is 37 years old and married with four children, all of whom are still in school. He and his wife have worked very hard for years to support their family by farming rice on three hectares of farmland in the local area. The current business earns them about 33,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 14,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

This is the third loan for Chean with VisionFund. He completely repaid the past loans. Now he is leading his group to request a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Chean is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his crop yield so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Phat is now 53 years old and married. She has seven children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. Phat and her husband are farmers who grow rice as their main business to support the family and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for 33 years, they are able to make daily earnings of 17,000 KHR and manage to save about 8,000 KHR each day. 

This is the seventh loan for Phat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy gasoline for her water pumping and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees in plowing the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her rice plantation and also grow her crops healthily to make more income to improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for her water pumping

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina was born in the district of Challambamba but lives in the community of Jajahuana, located in the Challabamba district, within the Paucartambo province and Cusco department, Perú. She is 27 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one daughter, Ruth, four years of age.

Karina belongs to Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Communal Bank. She makes and sells fried potatoes with either hot dogs or chicken, a very successful business she has had for one year. She usually buys all of her ingredients (potatoes, hot dogs, chickens, rice, oil) wholesale and is requesting this loan to buy more such ingredients wholesale.

Karina is happy about the loan and pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy ingredients wholesale.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos están en la universidad estatal y uno en un colegio de su comunidad, viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada la comunidad Calachaca de la localidad de Pucarani.
El estudió hasta el nivel de técnico medio y actualmente es productor lechero además de técnico agrícola en su localidad
El crédito lo requiere para compra de una segadora para cortar el forraje (alimento para las vacas);de esta manera ayudar a que su producción sea más limpia y mejorar su calidad de vida y de sus hijos.
El sueño de Pedro es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Pedro is married and has four children. Three of them are at the state university and one  is at the high school in his community. They live in his own house. The house is located in the community of Calachaca in the area of Pucarani. He studied up until the medium technical level and currently is a dairy producer as well an agricultural technician in his area. He needs the loan to buy a reaper to cut the fodder (feed for the cows). In this way, he will help his production to be cleaner and  improve his quality of life and that of his children. Pedro's dream is that his children become professionals. This is the first time he is requesting a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a reaper to cut more cleanly the feed for the cows.

loans.name: Heap's Group

texts.en:
Heap is 40 years old, married, and has five children. She and her family live in a village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she and her husband have been planting cassava on one hectare of farmland for 20 years, earning about 18,000 KHR per day.

 
Heap's Group consists of two women. She is requesting her seventh loan and the other group member is requesting her third loan from VisionFund. Heap will use her portion of the loan to purchase fertilizers for her farmland and to pay labor fees for plowing her field. She has successfully used the past loans to improve her family’s livelihood. With this loan, she hopes to improve her crops to produce higher yields in order to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Railway Line Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Railway Line” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request a loan of 500,000.00 SLL each in order to invest in their respective businesses.

Fatmata, the featured leader of this group, is a 38-year-old married mother of three children, two in primary school and one in secondary school. For the past 10 years Fatmata has been selling clothes and shoes. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying a large quantity of clothes and shoes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes and shoes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi, a 24-year-old married mother of a one-year-old, established her poultry farming business in 2005, Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.

Laxmi has already received and repaid six loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent one to buy small chicks. She is now requesting this loan to buy more chicks. In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buys small chicks.

loans.name: Soern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Soern is a 54-year-old mother of three children. She has been planting cassava on 1.5-hectare of farmland to earn a living. Having been in the business for 30 years, Soern can earn daily income of approximately KHR 20,000 and is able to save about KHR 8,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the second loan for Soern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. She wisely and successfully used the first loan from VisionFund Cambodia to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve financial burdens. 

Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use some of her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland and some to pay labor fees. This loan will enable her to grow her cassava healthily and fruitfully. Soern hopes to earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa 42 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in the community of Jajahuana, located in the Challabamba district within the Paucartambo province and Cusco department, Perú. Marcosa belongs to Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Communal Bank and their main economic activities are agriculture and raising small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and hens.  

Marcosa is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, de 37 años de edad , esta casada, ella tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de su pareja, sus hijos y algunos hermanos, ella junto a los miembros de su familia trabajan día a día para tener una mejor calidad de vida.El trabajo de Doris, consiste en la venta de cosméticos, vende todo tipo de artículos mediante el sistema de venta por catálogo, tiene una vitrina en su casa en donde llegan sus clientes en busca de perfumes, talcos, cremas, desodorantes o algún accesorio de utilidad. Lleva en ésta actividad un promedio de 6 años, trabaja sola y gana muy bien. Alterna esta actividad eventualmente con la venta de gaseosas dependiendo de la temporada.Por lo pronto, continúa trabajando en la venta de cosméticos y le gusta lo que hace, asegura sus ganancias con los clientes que ya ha logrado consolidar con el paso de los años, está muy contenta por la independencia que tiene .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 1000, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este crédito para continuar con el logro de sus objetivos ,por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado comprará principalmente cosméticos como talcos, cremas, perfumes y otros accesorios femeninos que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Doris is 37 years old, married, and has her own home that she lives in with her partner, her children, and some of her siblings. With her family, she works every day to improve her quality of life. Doris' work involves selling cosmetics. She sells lots of different kinds of products through catalogs. She has a display case in her home, where customers come to buy perfume, talc, creams, deodorants or some other item they use. 

She has worked in this business for around six years; she works alone and earns a lot of money. Sometimes she alternates this activity with selling soda, depending on the time of year. For the time being, she will continue to work selling cosmetics. She enjoys this work, and maintains her earnings with the customers she has built up over the years. She is very content about having her independence. 

On this occasion, she is requesting S/1000, and is grateful to everyone who help provide her with this loan so that she can continue to achieve her goals. She is also committed to making her loan repayments on time. She will mainly use the loan to buy cosmetics such as talcum powder, creams, perfume and other women's accessories that her customers want to buy.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Noerng's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager living in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Noerng is 35 years old and married, with two children, both of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. 

Noerng is a farmer who has been growing cassava on one hectare of farmland for 15 years to make a living. Noerng can earn about KHR 18,000 per day from the current business and manage to save KHR 7,000 daily for future needs.

This is the fourth loan for Noerng’s Group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. Now Noerng is leading her group to ask for a loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. 

As the leader, Noerng will use some of her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and some to pay labor fees. Noerng hopes to increase her farming production to generate more income, to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: En's Group

texts.en:
En is 55 years old and married. She lives with her husband and ten children in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. 

En and her husband are farmers who have been growing cassava and rice on four hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for 30 years, together, they can earn about KHR 40,000 per day. 

En is in her seventh cycle as a client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia and she completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her family’s living conditions. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and to pay labor costs. She hopes to grow her business and make more crops, to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy goods (sugar, oil, peanuts, rice, beverages and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Mateus

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 6 filhos, 1 já maior de idade e os outros 5 ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É agente de serviço numa instituição do Estado e comerciante. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (milho, açúcar, óleo, amendoim, arroz e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja construir uma outra casa ainda maior e oferecer mais conforto a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir um novo terreno para construir uma outra casa ainda maior para a sua família.
texts.en:
Mateus is married and the father of 6 children; 1 who is of age and the other 5 still go to School. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a government employee and a merchant. With this loan he plans to buy products (corn, sugar, oil, peanuts, rice and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

In future Mateus hopes to build another house even bigger than the one he has now to afford his family more comfort. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to obtain a new piece of land on which to build a bigger house for his family.

loans.use: buy products (corn, sugar, oil, peanuts, rice and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

loans.name: Victória

texts.pt:
Solteira sem filhos ainda, vive na casa cedida pelos pais e sustenta seu sobrinho que vive com ela.
É agente de serviço numa instituição estatal e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, porta, comento, tubos e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção. 
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa e mobilar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir mais empréstimos e realizar os seus objectivos
texts.en:
Victória is single and doesn't yet have any children. She lives in a house lent to her by her parents and supports a nephew who lives with her.

She's an employee for a government body and with this loan she plans to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, doors, cement, tubes and others) to continue the building work on her home.

In future Victória hopes to finish building her house and to furnish it.  To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to obtain more loans to reach her objectives.

loans.use: buy construction materials (zinc sheets, doors, cement, tubes and others) to continue the building work on her home.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É agricultor e possui uma área para a produção de hortícolas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar insumos agrícolas (semente, fertilizantes, pesticidas e outros) para a Produção de tomate.
