No futuro deseja concluir a ampliacao da sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é investir ainda mais na sua actividade para subir os níveis de rendimento
texts.en:
Armando is married and the father of 3 children who go to School, lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a farmer and owns a piece of land for horticultural activities. With this loan he plans to buy agricultural raw materials (seeds, fertilisers, pesticides and others) for the production of tomatoes.

In future Armando hopes to add an extension to his house. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to invest even more in his activity in order to increase his level of income.

loans.use: buy agricultural raw materials (seeds, fertilisers, pesticides and others) for the production of tomatoes.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É Docente e quadro do Ministério da Educação e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, chapas, cimento, areia, blocos e outros) para dar continuidade com ampliação da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja adquirir um meio de transporte para auxiliar na deslocação ao posto de trabalho, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e conseguir melhorar o nível de vida da sua família.
texts.en:
Bernardo is married and the father of 2 children who go to School. He lives in a house he owns with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a teacher and a permanent employee of the Ministry of Education. With this loan he plans to buy construction materials (iron, metal sheets, cement, sand, blocks and others) to continue to build the extension on his home.

In future Bernardo hopes to acquire a form of transport to help him get to and from work. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to work harder in order to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy construction materials (iron, metal sheets, cement, sand, blocks and others) to continue to build the extension on his home.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ekouéssan

texts.fr: Mr Ekouessan est âgé de 42ans. Il est infirmier de profession. Il exerce son activité à domicile et sollicite son cinquième crédit de WAGES pour acheter des produits pharmaceutiques. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité, ouvrir un autre cabinet pour mieux s’occuper des patients. Il veut construire sa propre maison et assurer l’avenir de la famille. Notons qu’Il est marié à une revendeuse et père de famille.
texts.en: Mr. Ekouessan is 42 years old. He is a nurse by profession. [N.B. His profession was mistranslated as a doctor in a previous loan.] He runs his own business out of his home and is seeking his fifth WAGES loan in order to purchase pharmaceutical products. He wants to reinvest in his business and open another office to better care for patients. Mr. Ekouessan wants to build his own home and ensure his family's future. Please note that he is married to a retailer and is the head of the family.

loans.use: To purchase pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia nació en el comunidad de Taquile (Puno, Cusco) pero vive en la ciudad de Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Chanca” pues es  una persona responsable y emprendedora pues su actividad económica es la venta de pollipapas y salchipapas, ella tiene  un carrito salchipapero donde prepara sus ricos potajes y la podemos encontrar en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Challabamba, ella sale a vender desde las 2pm hasta las 9pm de lunes a domingos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio  y le va excelente. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo pollos, salchicha, papas y otros insumos. Agradece a todas las personas por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar puntual sus cuotas.
texts.en: Teodosia was born in the town of Taquile in Puno, Cusco, but she now lives in the city of Challabamba. Challabamba is located in the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, Peru. Teodosia is 29 years old and has a partner, with whom she has two daughters. She belongs to the “Virgen de Chanca” community bank, and is a responsible and enterprising individual. She works selling chicken and potatoes and sausage and potatoes. She has a stand where she prepares her delicious dishes, and she can be found in one of the markets of the city of Challabamba. She goes out to sell her food from 2pm to 9pm from Mondays to Sundays. She has made a living in this way for several years and it is going very well. On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy ingredients, such as chicken, sausages, potatoes and other items. She is grateful to everyone for the loan and is committed to making her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as chicken, sausages, potatoes and other items.

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Prey Chhor district, Norn is 33 years old and married. She has three children, all of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. 

Norn has been farming rice and raising ducks. Having been in this business for almost 10 years, she can earn about KHR 40,000 per day. 

This is the first microloan for Norn’s Group with VisionFund Cambodia. Norn is leading her group to ask for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. 

As the leader, Norn will use a portion of her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and a portion of it to buy duck feed for her duck-raising. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income, to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and duck feed for her duck-raising.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Atália

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 5 filhos, 2 dos quais já maiores de idade e os outros ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É jardineira e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar bens (congelador, cama e Televisor) para oferecer mais comodidade a sua familia. 
No futuro deseja construir uma casa melhorada porque ainda vive numa de material local, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é ter mais uma fonte de receita para ultrapassar as dificuldades financeiras.
texts.en:
Atália is a widow and the mother of 5 children, 2 of whom are of age but the others still go to School. She lives in a house she owns with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a gardner and with this loan she plans to buy goods (a freezer, a bed and a TV) to provide more comfort for her family.

In future Atália hopes to build a better house because she still lives in one built from local materials. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to have another source of income so as to overcome her financial difficulties.

loans.use: buy goods (a freezer, a bed and a TV) to provide more comfort for her family.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat, 27 years old, is a married mother of one son, living in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Rice farming and cassava planting are the main sources of her family’s income. Having been in this business for several years, Sinat can earn about KHR 40,000 per day, but she can save about KHR 15,000 each day, after daily expenses. 

Sinat is just with VisionFund Cambodia for this cycle. Now, she is requesting a loan of KHR 4,000,000 from VisionFund Cambodia to buy fertilizer and seeds for her cultivated land and to spend plowing the field. With this loan, Sinat hopes to grow her rice and cassava healthily and to sell it for a good price, to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her cultivated land.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a farmer who lives in Nanyuki, Kenya. He is married and the father of three school-aged children. Gerald has been in this business for the last forty years, and raises cows as well as crops. He is requesting a loan for 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farm. He looks forward to increasing his income so that he can pay for the education of his children and improve the overall living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Isatu from Waterloo, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married and the mother of two children who are 7 years and 12 years old.  Both of her children attend school. She started running a food-selling business after she had to drop out of school because her family was too poor to continue her education. She has been in this business for ten years and works every day from morning to night.  At present her main challenge is transportation. Isatu has requested a loan to buy more ground nuts, beans, gari (a cassava-based dish) and native rice. The extra income she earns from this loan will allow her to pay her bills and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her food service into a general merchandise business and build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more ground nuts, beans, gari and  rice.

loans.name: Sospeter

texts.en:
Sospeter lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has four children. He owns a retail shop, a business which he has been running for five years. In this business, he sells retail stock such as rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil. He is also formally employed.
He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the high cost of products. 
Sospeter is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like sugar and flour. The extra income generated by the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like sugar and flour.

loans.name: Ahime

texts.fr: Ahimé est une revendeuse de matelas, coussins et draps au marché. Elle a 31 ans, mère de 03 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle sollicite son second crédit à WAGES pour assurer le ravitaillement et utiliser les profits obtenus pour ouvrir une maroquinerie. Elle est dans l'activité il y a 03ans.
texts.en: Ahimé is a retailer of mattresses, cushions, and bed sheets at the market. She is 31 years old and the mother of three children, all provided with schooling. She is requesting a second WAGES loan to ensure she is stocked up with supplies and will use the profits gotten for opening a hardware store. She has been in this business for three years.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses, cushions, and sheets

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: A citizen of a rural area located in the Kror Kor district, where farming is a common way of earning a living, Sina is 34 years old and married. She and her husband have struggled to support the family and feed her two children by farming rice and raising pigs. Both of her children are in school. She has been in the business for 10 years, and the business currently earns her approximately 10,000 KHR per day. Sina has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles, and she completely paid back the loans. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Sina will use her portion to buy a plot of farm land. She hopes to expand her farming business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farm land.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mohamed from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He is married with two children, ages 3 and 5. His children are currently attending school. In 2008, Mohamed established his general store business. When he lost his father, there was no one to take care of the family so he decided to start a business. He works at the business every day from morning to night. He has 10 dependents at home because they are relatives. He says that the main challenges to his business are price inflation and insufficient capital to run his business.

Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more cigarettes, mosquito spray, butter and biscuits. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his young sister's school fees and take care of his family. In the future, Mohamed plans to operate an international business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cigarettes, mosquito spray, butter and biscuits for his store.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a happy person who took out a previous loan. He increased his income and repaid the loan on time. He is grateful to the lenders. Josphat is therefore asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase more household items to sell. He now employs one more person in the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional retail products like soap, vegetables, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Samuel G

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Samuel from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He is married with four children between the ages of 3 and 16. His children are currently going to school.

Samuel runs a tailoring and clothing business selling different types of prepared clothes. He has been running this business for the past 20 years. He works at the business from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. based on the customers' demands. His business is the only source of income he has to support his family. He says the major problems to his business are poor electricity to do his stitching work and insufficient capital to expand his business.  

Samuel has requested a loan in order to buy different kinds of clothes, an advanced sewing machine and generator. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his children's school fees and take good care of his family. In the future, he plans to open a tailoring school. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of clothes, an advanced sewing machine and generator.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 67 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y un hijo actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de papa, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Misael, an entrepreneurial man, is 67 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and now son. He is requesting a loan with the desire to purchase supplies like fertilizer and fumigants. He wants to assist the cultivation of potatoes, with the end of keeping them in good condition during their development to obtain a high quality product. The only limitation that his man has is that he lacks the funds to continue growing. He ability to move forward depends on this economic activity and for that reason he is making a loan request. It is his first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He is not registered for any other loans in state banks, and FUDECOSUR has provided him with the better facilities and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for a potato plantation.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Mirlith

texts.es:
Mirlith, de 39 años de edad es madre soltera, vive en una casa propia a lado de siete personas entre sus hermanos .El trabajo de Mirlith consiste en el alquiler de equipos de sonidos , brinda este servicio a personas interesadas en amenizar con buena música y sonido de calidad alguna actividad deportiva, cumpleaños, fiestas, eventos o cualquier reunión de confraternidad. Trabaja por lo general los fines de semana en donde tiene mayor demanda, sin embargo, durante la semana también consigue algunos contratos que le ayudan a percibir ingresos para sobrellevar los gastos diarios. Este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 10 años, siente que le va bien ya que su clientela se ha multiplicado. Además vende cosméticos en su casa como talcos, perfumes y cremas, los mismos que son exhibidos en una vitrina.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera buenos ingresos además que se divierte desarrollando su labor, durante el tiempo que lleva realizando esta actividad aprendió muchas cosas y continuamente está en busca de nuevos clientes por lo que espera seguir con su etapa de crecimiento. Su meta principal es implementar su trabajo con otros accesorios de sonido, por lo pronto va comprando poco a poco algunos instrumentos que son necesarios para que continúe brindando un buen servicio. 
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 2000, agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este financiamiento ya que le brinda la seguridad para continuar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará cables de conexión eléctrica y otros implementos que usa en su trabajo de alquiler de equipos de sonido.
texts.en:
Mirlith, who is 39 years old, is a single mother.  She lives in her own house along with seven people, including her siblings.  Mirlith's work consists of renting sound equipment.  She provides this service to people interested in relaxing with good music and quality sound, sporting activities, birthdays, parties, events or any other social gathering.

She generally works on weekends, when she has the greatest demand, but she also gets some contracts during the week, which help her receive income to pay for daily expenses.

She has been doing this work for 10 years.  She feels that it is going well for her, since her clientele has multiplied.  She also sells cosmetics from home, like talcs, perfumes and creams, the same ones that are displayed in a showcase.

What she likes about her work is that it generates good income for her, and that she has fun doing it.  During the time that she has been doing this work, she has learned a lot of things, and she is constantly in search of new customers so that she can continue growing.

Her main goal is to do her work with other sound accessories.  At this time, she is requesting a loan of 2000 soles.  She thanks whoever gives her the opportunity to access this financing, since it provides her with security to continue with her work.  On the other hand, she is once again committed to making her payments on time.

With the requested amount, she will buy electrical connection cables and other equipment that she uses in her job renting sound equipment.

loans.use: to purchase electrical connection cables.

loans.name: Ashly  Anielka

texts.es: Ashly, es una jovencita de 23 años soltera, estudiante de la carrera de derecho por medio de una beca, labora como docente de preescolar colaborando al desarrollo de los niños lo cual le gusta mucho, para Ashly el finalizar sus estudios es muy importante porque le permitirá crecer económica y profesionalmente, solo de esa manera podrá aportar ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Ahora ella está solicitando apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación ya que su salario es muy bajo y no puede cubrir este costo de un solo pago.
texts.en: Ashly is a 23-year-old, single young woman studying law on scholarship.  She works as a preschool teacher helping with the development of children, a job she enjoys very much.  For Ashly, completing her studies is very important because it will make it possible for her to grow economically and professionally; this is the only way she’ll be able to contribute towards household expenses.  She’s requesting financial support now in order to pay for her final course since her salary is too low and not sufficient to be able to cover this cost in one payment.

loans.use: to pay for her final courses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María  tiene  31  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y un hijo actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar materiales e insumos para iniciar el proyecto de hidroponía. Ella piensa iniciar esta actividad con el anhelo de percibir más ingresos, ella tiene pensado vender el producto a los vecinos y en los negocios, y así con su proyecto  poder generar más ganancias para contribuir con su familia, ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que ella solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: María, 31, is married living with her husband and son at present.  She intends to use this loan to buy supplies and materials to start a hydroponics project.  She plans to start this activity hoping to earn higher income.  She plans to sell the products to neighbors and to businesses thus earning higher profits by means of her business to contribute to her family.  She does not have the necessary capital for said purchase because she’s of low income and does not have a way of getting the money needed for this which is why she requested a loan, her first from Fudecosur.  She’s had no previous loans from state banks and Fudecosur has provided the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy hydroponics supplies.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 45-year-old Isatu from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is a widow with four children between the ages of 10 and 25. Two are going to school and one is in university. Isatu maintains a general stock; she sells rice, sugar, salt and flour. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation. Isatu has applied for a loan to buy more general stock for resale, such as rice, sugar, salt and flour. The extra income from this loan will allow her to build a permanent business structure. In the future, she plans to import goods from overseas. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more general stock, such as rice, sugar, salt and flour, for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is grateful to all the lenders for the previous loan she received. The businesses are providing an increased income to her family. Mary would like to increase the operations of her business and is focused in investing into other areas. Mary is asking for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to buy more stationery and use the income to set up a mobile phone business.

loans.use: To buy more stationery.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu, 33, is from Waterloo, which is in the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married and has a 15-year-old child. Her child is currently attending school. 

Some years ago, Salamatu established her business. She began her business when she get pregnant and decided to no longer further her education.   She decided to start a business because her parents also operated a business. 

Salamutu works at her business from 7:00 am until 8:00 pm, six days per week. She says that the main challenge for her business is transportation.

Salamatu is requesting a loan to buy more rice, Maggie, onion, cooking oil, and seasoning. She hopes that the extra income generated from this loan will allow her to create a permanent source of income for her family. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her food store business. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, Maggie, onions, cooking oil, and seasoning

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi runs a small business selling garden eggs (a type of herb) in Enyan Apaa, a town near the Cape Coast. She graduated from junior high school and is now the mother of six children. Her husband is a farmer, and she has been in her current line of work for six years. She uses her income to help her husband pay their utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using this loan to buy an increased quantity of garden eggs to sell, and thereby meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her business to fulfill her dream of buying a garden-eggs stand, which will allow her to work from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to buy garden eggs.

loans.name: Salame

texts.en:
The coconut, roofing materials, and clothes businesses, owned by Salama, have continued to provide her with an income. She is grateful to the lenders for the previous loan she received. She looks forward to setting up a cereals business. 

She is applying for a loan of KES 21,500 (Kenya shillings) to buy cereals, like beans, and coconuts to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals and coconuts.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, tiene 32 años de edad , esta casada con Omer y junto a él tiene dos hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. Vive en la casa de su madre junto a su pareja y sus hijos además de sus hermanos y cuñados. La actividad de Julia consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas bien heladas, de manera constante recibe en su casa al representante de la empresa distribuidora quien se encarga de anotar su pedido para que al día siguiente le envíen la cantidad solicitada de acuerdo a su capital, luego sencillamente los coloca en su congelador y espera la llegada de sus eventuales clientes. Trabaja sola desde hace 3 años y su inversión semanal varía de 350 a 400 soles.Si bien es cierto que su negocio le produce buenos ingresos económicos, siente que aún es poco para alcanzar a cubrir sus principales gastos en su hogar y es por eso que desea establecer un negocio relacionado con el sector de la salud, con ello espera mejorar su economía.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 1500, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará más bebidas gasificadas para continuar vendiendo y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Julia, 32, is married to Omer and they have two children together who are 10 and 3 years of age respectively.  She lives in her mother‘s house with her husband and children and also with her siblings and siblings-in-law.  

Julia’s activity consists in selling ice-cold, carbonated beverages.  She constantly receives at home representatives from various suppliers who take down her order to deliver the next day what she’s asked for according to her available capital.  She then simply places them in her cooler and waits for drop-in customers to show up.  She’s worked alone this way for three years and her weekly investment varies from 350 to 400 soles.  Even though her business generates good income, she still feels that it’s too little to cover her basic household needs which is why she wants to establish a business in the health field hoping thus to improve her income.

On this occasion, she will request 1,500 soles and she’s grateful to those people who provide financing she needs to make her plans reality.  On the other hand, she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested amount to buy more carbonated beverages to continue selling and earning more profits.

loans.use: to buy carbonated soft-drinks.

loans.name: Elim Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios empresarios, uno de ellos es Yader tiene 37 años de edad, soltero con dos hijos menores. Su negocio es la de brindar servicio de fotocopias en su domicilio, además es subdirector de un colegio privado de su localidad, esta actividad tiene cinco años de emprenderlo, el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la  compra de tóner para la fotocopiadora, resma de papel carta, resma de papel legal etc. Elieth tiene 22 años y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y Grethel tiene 45 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa de cama.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three business partners, one of whom is Yader.  He is 37 years old, single and with two young children.  His business is to provide photocopying service from his home.  He is also the assistant director of a private school in his area.

He started his business five years ago.  The loan he is applying for, he will invest in the purchase of toner for the photocopier, a ream of letter-sized paper, a ream of legal-sized paper, etc.

Elieth is 22 years old and makes her living selling cosmetics.  Grethel is 45 years old, and her business is selling bed clothes.

loans.use: to buy toner for the photocopier, a ream of white letter-sized paper, and a ream of white legal-sized paper.

loans.name: Bortha

texts.en: Bortha is grateful to Milango and all the lenders for the previous loan she received. It helped her buy chicks and feed and to construct a new shelter. Despite the low season, which occurred during the term of the previous loan, she was able to make the required repayments. She is now focused on setting up a new business to increase her income channels. Bortha is asking for a loan of 85,850 KES (Kenya shillings) to buy plastic chairs and tents for use during special occasions and celebrations. She believes this will provide an increased income to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs and tents to set up a new business (party supplies).

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and the mother of 10 children. She was educated through junior high school and currently earns a living by selling groceries in Enyan Apaa, a town near Cape Coast. She has worked in this field for about one year, and her husband is a farmer. Abena uses her income to help her husband pay for the family's expenses. She plans to use this loan to buy more groceries to sell. With the new profits she expects to earn, Abena plans to develop her business further by expanding into new markets.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Maame Esi

texts.en:
Maame Esi is married to a farmer. She is a junior high school graduate. She uses her income to help her husband pay household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. 

Maame Esi currently sells yams in Enyan Apaa, which is near Cape Coast. With over three years of experience in this trade, Maame Esi sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. 

Her loan will be used to buy more yams, which will help her boost her overall sales. Maame Esi wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the increased profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more yams, which will help her boost her overall sales.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua grew up in poverty without an education, but this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. She currently earns a living by selling maize in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). Her business has grown substantially since she began it five years ago. She uses her income to help her husband raise their six children. She believes that there is growing demand among consumers for her product, and plans to use his loan to buy more maize to sell. With the new profits she expects to earn, Ekua wants to ensure that all of her children will be given the opportunity to advance and escape from poverty.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara, de 33 años de edad ,esta casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños con quienes vive en la casa propia que pudieron construir gracias al resultado de su trabajo.El trabajo de Sara consiste en la confección de prendas de vestir para damas caballeros y niños, ella se encarga con suma paciencia de elaborar las prendas que sus clientes le solicitan a pedido principalmente lencería femenina pero también elabora de manera particular y con frecuencia algunas prendas que ella personalmente diseña, las mismas que por su creatividad puede venderlas rápidamente, fabrica piezas en todos los colores y para todo tipo de acontecimientos. Se dedica a esta actividad más de 3 años, lo hace con muchas ganas porque es su pasión y se siente muy feliz cuando observa que su inspiración culmina en una hermosa prenda confeccionada por sus propias manos, siempre ha trabajado sola y afirma que nunca tuvo algún reclamo por parte de sus clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede plasmar en un prenda el diseño en que se inspira, se siente útil siempre, aunque asegura que no le agrada mucho elaborar pantalones de varón por el tiempo y la dificultad que le demanda; espera pronto construir un taller de costura mucho mas grande y destinar un espacio únicamente destinado a la venta de sus creaciones.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, elásticos, encajes y licra.
texts.en:
Sara, 33 years old, is married and has two young children with whom she lives in her own home, which they were able to build thanks to the results of her work.  

Sara's work consists of sewing garments for women, men and children.  With the greatest patience, she is responsible for making garments that her customers have ordered from her, primarily women's lingerie, but she also makes individual requests, and frequently some garments that she personally designs.  Due to her creativity, she is able to sell these quickly.  She makes pieces in all colors and for all types of events.

She has been in this line of work for more than 3 years.  She does it with a lot of enthusiasm because it is her passion, and she feels very happy when she sees that her inspiration culminates in a beautiful outfit made by her own hands.  She has always worked alone and states that she has never had any complaints from her clients.

What she likes about her work is that she can capture in one garment the design which inspires her, and that she always feels useful, although she claims that she doesn't particularly enjoy making men's pants because of the time and difficulty they involve.

She hopes to build a much larger tailoring workshop soon, and designate a space exclusively for selling her creations.

On this occasion, she is requesting 1200 soles.  She is grateful for the opportunity and trust that is placed in her in order to receive this loan.  On the other hand, she is committed to making her payments on time.

With the requested amount, she will buy sewing supplies, like fabric, thread, elastic, lace and lycra.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies, like fabric, thread, and elastic, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cookstove products for sale to end users

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is grateful for the previous loan she received through Milango. She operates a retail business selling selling cereals and would like to expand her business to include the sale of groceries such as fruits and vegetables. She is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy potatoes, vegetables, and fruits to sell. 

She looks forward to raising more income to use towards educating her children.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, vegetables, and fruits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase daily use products

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es: Eloisa tiene 35 años de edad y vive en la zona sur del país junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos, todos menores de edad y asisten a la escuela pública. Hace dos años Eloisa tuvo la idea de incursionar en el área de las ventas y puso su propio negocio donde vende artículos diversos como cosméticos (polvos, rubor, lápiz de ojos, mascara, pintalabios), papelerías (cartulinas, hojas de impresión, folders y otros artículos del uso de los estudiantes), algunas cosas de uso personal (bandas y bolitas de pelo) y una gran variedad que llega hasta juegos de mesa como el parches (parcheesi), todo en cantidades muy pequeñas pues no tiene mucho espacio ni un gran capital para mantener un inventario grande. Por esta razón Eloisa está solicitando un préstamo de 5,300 pesos ya que con esa inversión podrá tener más mercancías para sus ventas y esto se traducirá en mayores ingresos. Su deseo es ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida proveyéndoles lo necesario según su edad.
texts.en: Eloisa, 35, lives in the southern part of the country with her husband and four children, all minors attending public school.  Two years ago, Eloisa got the idea of going into sales and she opened her own business selling various items like cosmetics (powder, blush, eyeliner, mascara, lipstick), stationery supplies (construction paper, printer paper, folders and other school supplies) and some personal use items (hair bands and hair clips) and a wide variety of items including even table games like Parcheesi.  She sells in small amounts because she does not have much space or much capital to keep a large inventory.  Because of this, Eloisa is requesting a 5,300 pesos loan because with such an investment she’ll have more merchandise to sell which will result in higher income.  Her wish is to offer her children better quality of life providing everything they need according to their age.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
After graduating middle school, Aba decided to set up her own maize and garden egg business in Enyan Apaa, which is near Cape Coast. With over ten years worth of experience, she is currently looking to further expand her enterprise. 

Unfortunately, Aba's plans are limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, she is requesting a loan, which will be used to help her by purchase more maize and garden eggs to sell. Her goal is to use the profits from her business to help support her husband, who is a farmer, with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their ten children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more maize and garden eggs to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is happy about Milango and its partners for the loans he has received. He is a horticultural farmer who looks forward to achieving a greater output and helping to solve food insecurity.

Charles is applying for a new loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy seeds and fertilizers for crop farming both in the tea tree and horticultural business which he runs. He is looking for ways of mitigating the challenge of seasonal weather and business climate variables.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Los Tellez Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es María tiene 35 años de edad, acompañada, con un hijo menor, y tiene 7 préstamos que la institución le ha brindado y cumplidora con sus responsabilidades, tiene 7 años que se dedica a la venta de especies y cajetas que los comercializa en el mercado de su localidad y algunos municipios cercanos del país, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de achiotes, clavo de olor, pimienta, canela, materia prima para las cajetas como azúcar, rodamina, coyolitos, coco, leche etc. Francisco tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es venta de especies y Martha tiene 32 años de edad y su negocio es venta de granos básicos.
texts.en: This group is made up of three enterprising members. One of these members is María. She is 35 years old, and has a partner and a young child. The institution has given her 7 loans and she has met her responsibilities. For 7 years, she has made a living selling spices and candies in the local market and some nearby towns. She will invest the loan in buying achiote, cloves, cinnamon, and raw materials for the candies such as sugar, rhodamine, coyolito fruit, coconut, milk, etc. Francisco is 31 years old and makes a living selling spices, and Martha is 32 years old and makes a living selling basic cereals.

loans.use: to buy achiote, cloves, cinnamon, and raw materials for the candies such as sugar, rhodamine, coyolito fruit, coconut, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling kenkey in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. 

Efua is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her kenkey business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her in improving her sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her in improving her sales.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa, who is married to a farmer and has four children, received no formal education. She has been an entrepreneur for five years, specializing in selling garden eggs in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees.

Adjoa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels so she can sell greater quantities of garden eggs. She plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand to meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, thereby enabling her to sell greater quantities of garden eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is grateful for the previous loan she received. Her school has been experiencing increased enrollment. Her focus is to provide information and a communication course to the students. 

Anne is applying for a loan of 85,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase computers. She looks forward to buying a parcel of land on which to build a school structure so that she does not have to rent in the future.

loans.use: to buy computers for the school she owns.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a single mother of five children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Efua is a successful businesswoman. She sells food supplies in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast), an enterprise she has been involved in for about seven years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Efua uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Efua will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of food supplies, thereby enabling her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of food supplies, thereby enabling her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad who appears in the picture, is a 26-year-old single young man. Ahmad is employed in a local IT company and earns small salary, which is not quite enough to cover all his needs.

Ahmad lives with the rest of his family members in a small house, and he wants to contribute to the purchase of new living room furniture.

Ahmad is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve the living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer Ahmad and the rest of his family members comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To buy new living room furniture.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Marwan appears in her Kiva profile photo, with the picture inside the furniture store.

Randa is a 31-year-old young married woman and a mother to two sons and one daughter. Randa's husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is the only source of income for the family and not quite enough to cover all their needs.

Randa is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture in order to improve the living conditions of her children in her house. Taking this loan will offer Randa's children comfortable and suitable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Even though Ama grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Ama is an entrepreneur. She sells yams in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began four years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband meet some basic expenses of the home. 

Ama has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more yams to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more yams to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ama sells groceries in Enyan Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 12 years. She is married to a mason, and together they have two children. Ama uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of groceries, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of groceries.

loans.name: Vae

texts.en:
Vae is grateful for the previous loan she received. It assisted her to complete the construction of her rental houses and they are now rented. She has therefore been receiving income from this. She nonetheless would like to increase her income bracket.

Vae is therefore applying for a loan of 53,300 Kenya shillings to buy clothes for sale. She now also runs a transport business, owning a motorcycle which helps transport people and goods in the area. Vae believes all these will work towards helping to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Mohammad, appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Lubna is a 30-year-old, married, young woman and a mother to two sons and two daughters. Lubna's husband is employed and gets a low salary that is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Lubna is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help her cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve the living conditions of her family in the house. Taking this loan will offer to Lubna's family comfortable furniture, so they can enjoy living in their house.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see in fund-raising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy new living room furniture.

loans.name: Arcadio

texts.es: Arcadio, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 63 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Arcadio is an enterprising individual. He is 63 years old, married, and lives with his wife. He is requesting a loan because he wants to buy supplies such as compost and fumigants, to help his coffee crop so that it remains in good condition as it grows and so he obtains a high quality product. The only restriction this gentleman faces is his lack of money to keep growing, because they rely on this economic activity to succeed. For this reason, he is requesting a loan. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he has never taken out other loans with state banks. It is easier for him to get a loan with FUDECOSUR and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy supplies for coffee.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es: Asunción, de 35 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos hijos de 17 y 9 años, vive en el terreno de su madre.El trabajo de Asunción consiste en la venta de ropas como polos, pantalones, blusas y diversos cosméticos como perfumes, cremas faciales y corporales. Su clientela básicamente son sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, además de algunos nuevos clientes que siempre llegan por recomendación. Algunas veces le solicitan pedidos con anticipación, los cuales reparte en el transcurso del día que recibe su mercadería. Lleva ya trabajando en este rubro cerca de 4 años, trabaja sola ya que su pareja busca por su lado otros ingresos para su hogar.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para hacer muchas cosas diferentes, además tiene independencia y dispone de su tiempo para dirigirse a zonas o lugares donde cree que realizar alguna venta y conseguir nuevos clientes, por ahora espera consolidar su negocio ya que le esta yendo bien.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 2400 soles, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados ,por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos como perfumes, cremas faciales y corporales, sábanas y accesorios para que continúe vendiendo.
texts.en:
Asunción, 35, is married and has two children, ages 17 and 9.  She lives on her mother's land.

Asunción's job is selling clothing such as polo shirts, pants, and blouses, and a variety of cosmetics such as perfume, face cream, and body lotion.  Her customers are basically her friends, family members, and neighbors, as well as some new customers who always come on recommendation.  Sometimes they order in advance; she delivers these the day they arrive.

She has been working in this field for four years already.  She works alone because her husband has his own income for the household.  What she likes about her job is that she has time to do a lot of different things.  She also has the independence and the time to go to areas or places where she thinks she can make a sale and acquire new customers.  For now she hopes to strengthen her business because it's going well for her.

Currently she'll request 2400 soles [PEN].  This is why she's grateful to all the people who make her loan possible so she can continue doing her job with better results.  She promises to make her payments punctually.

With the amount requested she'll buy large quantities of cosmetics such as perfume, face cream, body lotion, sheets, and accessories so she can continue selling.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfume, talcum powder, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Kendal

texts.es: Kendal tiene la edad de 32 años, está casado y vive con la esposa y un hijo actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación café. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Kendal, 32, is married and currently lives with his wife and a child.

He wants the loan to buy soil amendments and to take care of his coffee farm.  He wants to give his crop the appropriate care so he can have a better harvest and, consequently, more income.

He hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future, as well as to keep growing as a person.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He had not had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Baba

texts.en:
Baba is 45 years old. He is married and has one daughter and one son. His wife is a homemaker. Baba breeds cattle to sell to local butchers and raises cows for their milk and milk products. In this business his wife also helps him. His work is the only financial income for his family.

Baba has ten years of experience with livestock, thanks to his father who taught him the best way to look after his animals. He usually buys young cattle, raises and fattens them for five to six months and then sells them at a profit in the local livestock bazaar. He also sells milk and yoghurt to his neighbors. All together, these activities bring in 180 AZN a month but are not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Milk and yoghurt as well as beef and mutton are very popular in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolmas and always use yoghurt as a sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and are also present in everyday life.

Baba is applying for a 2000 AZN loan to buy three head of cattle, one milk cow and some fodder. This will be his second loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy three head of cattle, one milk cow and some fodder.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the photo inside his store.

Aysha is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother to six sons, all of them over 18 years old.

For the past five years, Aysha's husband has had a general store selling different types of cleaning products. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family.

Aysha is requesting a 2,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing needed cleaning products that customers often request, such as shampoo, laundry and tile cleaning materials. This will increase sales and increase Aysha's husband's income, which will contribute to provide better living conditions for Aysha and her family.

loans.use: To buy more cleaning products to sell

loans.name: Gloria Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres microempresarios de éxito uno de ellos es José tiene 37 años de edad, acompañado tiene dos años de dedicarse a vender utensilios de plásticos de manera ambulante y en el mercado de su localidad, su compañera y él se encargan del negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de picheles plásticos, canastillos , tazas de vidrios, tinajas, monederos, coladores etc., Socorro tiene 65  años de edad y su negocio es la venta de fritos de cerdo, Jerónima tiene 51 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de tortilla y un pequeño taller de costura.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful micro-entrepreneurs.  One of them is José, 37.  He's married and has made a living for two years selling plastic utensils on foot and in the market of his town.  He and his companion are responsible for the business.

He'll invest the loan in buying plastic jugs, small baskets, glass cups, clay jars, purses, colanders, etc.

Socorro, 65, sells "fritos de cerdo" [fried pork dish].  Jerónima, 51, sells tortillas and has a small sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy jugs, baskets, cups, jars, purses, colanders, etc.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old single young man. He has a greenhouse located on a piece of land he bought three years ago. Ahmad plants different types of vegetables in the greenhouse and sells them in the market.  This has been a profitable project, but he needs more support to cover some costs.

Ahmad is requesting a 1,200 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing seedlings and agricultural fertilizer. It will allow him to produce a better crop, thus increasing his sales and improving his income positively. 

Ahmad is pictured in front of his greenhouse.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his greenhouse.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David was born in the community of Jajahuana and lives in the same community where he was born. (The Jajahuana community is located in the Challabamba district, within the Paucartambo province and Cusco department, Perú). He is 23 years old and single. He belongs to Santa Isabel de Jajahuana Communal Bank and their main economic activities are agriculture, transportation services and livestock. He needs this loan to buy more animals, such as bulls and cows. His dream is to buy a car. He's happy about the loan and pledges to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as bulls and cows.

loans.name: Affiwa

texts.fr: Affiwa âgée de 33ans vit avec son mari mécanicien soudeur à Lomé. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle revend depuis 2007 dans une boutique du déodorant et des savons. Son achat se fait dans la zone portuaire et elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises en quantité considérables. Elle espère assurer la santé de la famille tout en gardant la pérennité de  son activité.
texts.en: Affiwa, 33 years old, lives in Lomé with her husband, who works as a mechanic and welder. In order to help her husband with household needs, since 2007 she has been selling deodorant and soap in a store. She stocks up near the port. She is requesting her first loan to stock up a large quantity of merchandise. She hopes to be able to pay for her family’s healthcare while stabilizing her business.

loans.use: to buy deodorant and soap.

loans.name: Las Abejas De Qquehuña Grande Ii Group

texts.en:
The Communal bank "Las Abejas de QQuehuna", which was founded in April 2013, is currently in its first cycle. It is comprised of 21 members, 18 women and 3 men. The QQuenua community is located in the province of Paucartambo, in the Huancarani district of the department of Cusco, which is located one hour and 45 minutes from the city of Cusco, by way of unpaved road. 

The members are workers and entrepreneurs who seek opportunities at every moment to get ahead and through their daily efforts, to provide a better future for their children. The main economic activities of the partners are agriculture and livestock; others are engaged in selling food, the sale of vegetables, and the raising of small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and more.

Clemente was born in the community of QQuehuna and lives in the same community where he was born. He is 30 years old, married and has three children.  His main economic activity is making plaster. He has a little workshop at home where he makes the plaster. At this time he is requesting a loan in order to maintain his machinery and also to buy firewood.

loans.use: to maintain his machinery and to buy firewood

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
A $ 600 loan is offered to Filomena to improve her business. Filomena opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like oil, slippers, biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and cigarettes. 

Filomena is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Filomena is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, slippers, biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Judite

texts.en:
A $ 1,000 loan is offered to Judite to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and other goods.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and other items.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina is applying for a loan of $ 1.000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 29 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as fish in cans, oil, sugar, biscuits and coffee.

She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy, fish in cans, oil, sugar, biscuits and coffee.

loans.name: Aysa

texts.en:
Aysa works hard to support her family. Aysa is married and has a blacksmith business in the Philippines.

Aysa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like iron, wood, charcoal, etc for her business.

Aysa has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Aysa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like iron, wood and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria runs a kiosk, which she has been doing for three years.  She opened the kiosk with her own working capital of $100.  Maria is requesting a loan for $600, which she will use to purchase stock, such as slippers, cigarettes, and biscuits. Maria is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, cigarettes, and biscuits

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is married and sells fish in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 12 years.  She is requesting her second loan from NWTF for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more boxes of fish to sell.  In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is married and has a internet cafe business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 28 years. She is requesting a loan from NWTF for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase another computer and other equipment needed by her business.  In the future, Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and other equipment needed by her business

loans.name: Mamello

texts.en:
Mamello is applying for a second loan to support her last year and a half of studies at Maharishi Institute. She will graduate in December 2014. When asked about her progress since the first Kiva loan, Mamello reports:

"At the moment I'm doing economics, and it is very interesting. I'm on work-study finally, and I've been placed as a tutor. The task is challenging and very fun at the same time. I feel I'm giving back what I have learned and making it easier for other students to understand it. My year is looking good so far; I'm looking to do more."

video.title: Kiva Borrower Mamello from South Africa

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 46 years old, married, with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josie has a fish dealer business in the Philippines. Josie requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish dealer business. Josie has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Josie would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 37 years old and married to a farmer. They have two children. 

Clarita runs a store everyday, and receives around 300 PHP daily. Clarita and her spouse work hard in order to increase profits and customer loyalty. She is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell in her store.

With better profits in her business, Clarita will achieve higher income to use in the business and her children's education. She hopes to see her children work professionally in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Hermetes

texts.en:
Hermetes manages a talipapa (fruit and vegetable stall) in her village that allows her to provide for her family's living expenses. She buy fruits and vegetables at the market and re-sells them in her village. She has been in this business for eight years, and earns about 6,000 PHP each month. 

Hermetes is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy carrots, bananas, cabbages, eggplant, and onions to sell.

Selling more merchandise will help increase her profits, which will improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy carrots, bananas, cabbages, eggplant, and onions to sell

loans.name: Norema

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Norema works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Norema is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials like wood, paint, and fishing nets for her fishing business.

Norema has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, paint, and fishing nets for her business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion poured out her skills, cooking meals to sell as her income. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She has been in her food selling business for three years and earns PHP 6,000 each month. The money is used for meals and school fees. 

Salvacion is now borrowing loan of PHP 7,000 to buy pork, beef, fish, and chicken to cook and sell. She hopes to keep cooking delicious meals to earn more profits and establish a more convenient food stall.

loans.use: to buy pork, beef, fish, and chicken to cook and sell.

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is 50 years old and has twelve children. Bernadita is married and has four children who are in school.

Bernadita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bernadita has been raising pigs for 15 years now and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 31 years old, married and has three young children. She is managing a small store in their house and is able to gain PHP 5,000 each month. She uses it for revolving capital, bills at home and education expenses. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to use in buying canned goods, eggs, biscuits, soft drinks and soap to sell. It will help maintain good sales as well as customer satisfaction for good products and services to all her customers. 

In the future, Salvacion hopes to continuously acquire good sales and save a fund for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, biscuits, soft drinks and soap to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Two of her children attend school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business of buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Jocelyn has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Pio Xii Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cinco emprendedores una de ellas es Zoila mujer de 54 años de edad, acompañada, con un hijo , desde hace 10 años se dedica a realizar y vender nacatamales quienes los vende por encargos ya que es bien reconocida en la ciudad de Masaya y en su domicilio cuenta con dos trabajadores quienes devengan salarios, en la institución tiene 4 años de ser cliente quien a adquirido 12 préstamos que los paga en tiempo y forma, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como carne de cerdo, hoja de chagüites, mecates, arroz, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, sal, maíz, cal, papa,  etc. Zenobia tiene 45 años y su negocio es tener una pulpería en su domicilio, Melenciana tiene 59 años de edad y su negocio es venta de tortilla y frito de cerdo, Ignacio tiene 59 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de hoja de chagüites para hacer nacatamales y Humberto tiene 47años y su negocio es una panadería.
texts.en:
This group is made up of five entrepreneurs.  One of them is Zoila, 54.  She's married and has one child.  For ten years she has made a living making and selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales], which she sells on order because she's well recognized in the city of Masaya.  She has two salaried employees who work in her home.  She has been a client of the institution for four years and has acquired twelve loans, which she pays back in due time and form.

She'll invest the loan in buying ingredients such as pork, banana leaves, string, rice, peppers, onions, tomatoes, salt, corn, lime, potatoes, etc.

Zenobia, 45, has a grocery store in her home.  Melenciana, 59, sells tortillas and "frito de cerdo" [fried pork dish].  Ignacio, 59, sells banana leaves for making nacatamales.  Humberto, 47, has a bakery.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for tamales

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es: Grupo está formado por tres emprendedores una de ellas es Adriana mujer de 39 años, casada, con dos hijos  y con más de 15 años de experiencia como costurera, posee un pequeño taller de costura, su esposo le ayuda en la comercialización de productos a diferentes mercados locales así como mercados de la capital, su sistema de trabajo es por encargo, tiene dos trabajadores que les paga salario, el crédito lo solicita para invertir en materia prima como telas sincatex, gruesa de zipper, gruesa de botones, conos de hilos, mantas, etc. José tiene 59 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de leñas  nacatamales y Cándida tiene 46 años de edad y vende frutas frescas.
texts.en: This group is made up of three entrepreneurs, one of whom is 39-year-old Adriana.  She is married, has two children and over 15 years experience as a dressmaker.  She has a small sewing workshop and her husband helps to sell her products to different local markets, as well as markets in the capital city.  Adriana does work based on the orders she receives and she has two employees that help her.  This loan will be invested in buying basic materials such as material, buying zippers and buttons in bulk, threads, blankets and more.  José is 59 years old and he has a business selling firewood and corn-based food dishes.  Cándida is 46 and sells fresh fruit.

loans.use: to invest in buying raw materials, such as material, zippers and buttons in bulk, threads, blankets and more.

loans.name: Renato

texts.es:
Renato es dueño de una barbería que opera desde su casa. Tiene ya 10 años con el negocio dando servicio de corte de pelo a niños, jóvenes y adultos todos los días. A Renato le gusta mantenerse al día con los cambios de la moda en relación a cortes de pelo y con equipos profesionales y desea un préstamo de 10,600 pesos para acondicionar el negocio y comprar algunos equipos y mobiliario dando así un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Renato vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 9, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad. Viven al sur del país en un pueblo llamado Haina. Renato tiene muchos años de experiencia y le gusta lo que hace, “soy un estilista de muchos años de experiencia y este es un trabajo que me permite estar cerca de mi familia” refiere Renato. Renato está seguro de que este préstamo será de gran ayuda para seguir creciendo en su negocio ya que para el futuro desea un local más grande y poder contar con más estilistas trabajando con él. Esto sin duda será también un gran apoyo para mejorar la calidad de vida que le da a su familia.
texts.en:
Renato owns a barber shop that he operates out of his home.  He has had this business for 10 years, offering services such as haircuts for children, young people, and adults every day.  Renato likes to keep up to date with fashion changes with haircuts and professional teams.  He is requesting a loan of 10,600 pesos to make repairs to his business and purchase some equipment and furniture so that he can provide a better service to his customers.

Renato lives with his wife and their four children who are 2, 4, 6, and 9 years old.  They live in the south of the country in a town called Haina.  Renato has many years of experience and he likes what he does.  He says, "I am a stylist with many years of experience and this is a job that allows me to be close to my family." Renato is sure that this loan will be a big help in growing his business since in the future he wants to have a larger shop that employs other stylists to work with him.  It will also be a great help in improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs to his business and purchase razors, hair cutting machines, and furniture.

loans.name: Rovy

texts.en:
Rovy is 34 years old, married, and has five children.

She raises hogs and resells them at a higher cost once they mature. She has managed her business for over six years, and earns approximately 2,000 PHP for each mature hog that she sells. Rovy is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed and medicines to sustain the hogs while they grow. 

She hopes that her business will help her earn the funds necessary for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hog business

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, es viuda y tiene tres hijos de 22, 18 y 16 años de edad respectivamente. Ella tiene ocho años de dedicarse a la agricultura; desde que su esposo falleció ella busco una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos.
